Reviews.Title: “Just an Asian company can care this much about you!”
Reviews.Author: evazquezvela
Reviews.Content: Top of the line service, make you feel like home. BEST SPA in Town with amazing installations and extraordinary therapists. Room service very good and on perfect timing. Reception and valet staff so kind and helpfull, my favorite hotel in Vancouver by far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The service was incredible and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. The room was fantastic, the bed comfortable, the bathroom huge with great walk-in shower, large soaker tub and double vanity. Even had a very large deck. Great location with restaurants and shopping nearby. Didn't try the restaurant but have heard very good things about it. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mae C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while attending a conference. It was lovely all around. Warm greetings by staff. Quiet, but in the middle of downtown. Very comfortable bed, great city view (we had a corner unit with a balcony). Simple, but well done decor. So much nicer than the "big box" hotels. No long elevator waits. Loved the complementary water each night...and bookmarks, too. My only complaint would be fixing coffee proved a challenge because using the key to power the coffeemaker had to be done numerous times to get two cups of coffee. It became my personal adventure each morning and we laughed at process. Gosh, we must have been really relaxed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: eosinophil
Reviews.Content: I loved this property. Excellent service with very fast check in. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The complimentary fruit is a nice tough. I quite enjoyed the breakfast in the hotel. Great location, very close to Robson street and lots of shopping. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Chi Spa...”
Reviews.Author: Anika T
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the parkade to the spa...it was an amazing experience! The Spa was incrediable. If anyone ever has the pleasure of going to Chi Spa please make sure you ask for Roya...she will ensure your experience is unfortgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: tigerlilyCanada
Reviews.Content: What a peaceful, clean, elegant hotel. The staff is eager to please, always kind and friendly. It is located in the heart of the downtown core. Shops and restaurants just steps away. A gourmet supermarket named Urban Fare is just beside the hotel. I frequently visit Vancouver for business and pleasure. I will definitely be staying at the Shangr-La in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel for a phenomenal stay”
Reviews.Author: Lanica88
Reviews.Content: The Shang is an amazing hotel, both esthetically and in service. The staff were so warm and welcoming, not to mention respectful and accommodating. The service offered here truly makes you feel like a celebrity. I have nothing but the highest praises for the Shangri-La!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DBDowns
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Shangri-La a number of times and each visit was superb. The serene surroundings are my favourite part of the stay and together with the excellent, discreet service provided by all staff and the fabulous meals prepared in The Market restaurant, it is by far the BEST place to stay in Downtown Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect”
Reviews.Author: CDMTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my family on the way back from the mountains. Room was smart, comfortable and cool. Staff was wonderful. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: rmg95
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for 2 nights whilst exploring Vancouver for the first time. The checkin was quick and simple our room was clean spacious and comfortable, the rooms were cleaned daily and had a personal touch for our arrival which was really nice and welcoming. The bed was extremly comfortable, it was warm throughout and the bathroom was very well equipped. The hotel staff helped looked after our cases after we checked out so we could visit victoria for the day. Excellent hotel thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful touches throughout”
Reviews.Author: Julie U
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful with great touches everywhere. Everyone at the hotel was so hospitable and friendly. The rooms were very nice, although our room did not have a great view. The bathrooms were the highlight of the room, completely marble with a tv and separate bath and shower. There are bottled waters and candies left with the turned-down beds every night. It was the little touches that really made our stay wonderful in the end!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hopitality”
Reviews.Author: Michelle0630
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La in Vancouver for our anniversary and from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. The staff went above and beyond for us. Shortly after we arrived, the staff sent up a very decadent "Happy Anniversary" chocolate cake. Staff at the lounge, front desk and concierge were all very polite, helpful and friendly. Upon checkout the valet provided complimentary water for our drive home. The room itseft was impeccably clean and the decor was beautiful. Although we were only on the 14th floor we had a wonderful view of Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Exprerience EVER”
Reviews.Author: bmercant
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Views, Excellent Personalized service, and incredible food. There are T'v's in the marble bathroom mirrors and you get chocolate on your pillow. We were celebrating our marriage and even received special personalized free dessert and specail spa package deals. Honestly the attention to detail, food and incredible service makes me compare every hotel experience to this.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60805Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and extremely good value. Only a 1 night stop over stay breaking up a return from Whistler to home, but well worth it and definitly a good decision on our part. Our daughter's favorite hotel ever in fact she spent 2 hours in the bathroom watching tv from the mirror, taking a bath and then a shower with all the wonderful products provided - perfect to relax her tired and sore muscles from skiing all week. Top notch service and extremely friendly, without pretenses sometimes found in hotels of this quality. Pool and hot tub were nice as well. We got 2 double beds and were worried we wouldn't sleep well as we are used to a king, but wanted our daughter to have a bed as well. We were tired, but the bed quality was extremely good and we slept like babies and quite comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Luxurious, relaxed haven from bustling city shopping”
Reviews.Author: petewithleese
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to find yourself in the beautiful city of Vancouver BC and you want a well managed, friendly, relaxed, quiet, bespoke, classy & convenient Hotel experience then you should look no further. My wife and I have stayed many times at the Shangri-la in Bangkok and on a recent shopping trip to Vancouver decided to treat ourselves to the far from cheap experience that is the Shangri-la brand. The Hotel in Vancouver is very much in keeping with the world wide brand is really is the epitome of what a good city Hotel should be. The staff from check in to upgrade to valet parking to baggage valet service were so professional so friendly so relaxed yet discreet and formal enough to make you feel special and that you were staying in a Hotel away from the hum drum of inner city life. It is also in the perfect location to access the downtown of Vancouver whether your needs are retail based or foodie or culture based. Do yourselves a big favour, stop looking and book yourselves in, you will have a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is Shangri-La?”
Reviews.Author: emcgoo
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night at Shangri-La for a little getaway. The Shangri-La gets A LOT of hype and so I wanted to see for myself. I offer the caveat that I had high expectations. So, while little was wrong per se, it just was NOT a good value. The good: Rooms were clean and the toiletries, linens, towels and robes were of good quality. The fitness facility, steam rooms, outdoor pool, outdoor hot tub and the spa are all beautiful. Perhaps the nicest I have seen in Vancouver. The mediocre: Some of the service was great and some was poor so overall, it was mediocre. Hallway noise was audible in our first room. The standard rooms (Superior King) are very small. The decor is not impressive. Honestly, it is hard to believe that hotel was professionally decorated. Cords, are clearly visible. Curtains and wall hangings clash. Bathroom while lovely, does not compare to other hotels of that caliber. The story: So we booked a Superior King room and I was very disappointed by how small it was for the price. I was also disturbed by how loud the street noise was with the windows closed. We asked if there was room we could move to but were told the only option was an upgrade. So, we upgraded. For a small increase in price we got a much larger room on the quiet side of the building and without noisy neighbours. The check-in is located in the parking garage and is small and unimpressive. The line was long and there are only two work stations at the front desk. Slow. I also waited five minutes for an elevator. It took close to 30 minutes to get to our room. Our small and unimpressive room. We decided to grab a drink in the lounge. The lounge was nearly empty yet after far too long, I finally had to ask the bartender to send someone over. When we finally did get help, their product knowledge was not up to par although their selection was good. Predictably, room service was extremely expensive, edible but not great and the portions were tiny. Really, I could go on and on about how mediocre it was. Nothing terribly wrong (other than the small noisy room), but for the price, nothing terribly right either (other than the fitness area). Unless your primary goal is to shop on Robson street, head down to the water and stay in one of the harbour front hotels. Stay at one of the Marriott's or the Hyatt for half the price or spend the big money at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. I have to say that the Pacific Rim is in an entirely different league.

Reviews.Title: “incredible attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: 1ababychicken
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while on business in Vancouver. I was impressed with the refined rooms...full marble bathrooms with soaking tub, valet tray in the safe, turndown service with treats. The location is great too...within walking distance of so many restaurants and shops on Robson street. Also there is a gourmet grocery store next door if you need to self-cater. The drinks in the bar were sublime as well. Defnitely a step above most hotels I have stayed with.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Sheraton wall center but thought I would try this out and WOW! This is an amazing location - excellent staff and the rooms was just fabulous. Everything is touch control, including the curtains. I can not find any fault with the room - a 5 star for sure. my only comment is that i expected the hotel would be higher than 15 floors. I managed to get on the 15th floor but because of the other buildings had no view at all. The room and services more than made up for it. Room service and the lounge were also top notch! BOTTOM LINE - if view is not important you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Just as James Hilton described it.....a utopian earthly paradise, isolated from the outside world.”
Reviews.Author: LRJ13
Reviews.Content: There are times when you get a chance to get away for a holiday or vacation and you get lit up, taken a back and amazed by your destination. Well Vancouver is a great, lively, Canadian city that my g/f and I love to visit, and living in Seattle we've been there quite a few times (just check my other reviews). This time though I'm not going to say the hotel or property became a destination in itself, but boy howdy does it come close...... We were there for our annual Leafs v. Canucks hockey game at Rogers arena (3 years in a row!!!) and found online that the Shangri-la was first; running a special, and second because of this "Experience Shangri-la" package made it less expensive than our usuals (Sheraton, Hyatt, Le Soleil, Sutton Place), we jumped on it right away. We arrived in Vancouver late in the evening, and since I didn't want to pay for the valet $39 Canadian (because we now have our own little secret parking place in downtown), and 39 dollars is not expensive, and not any more than other properties around the city. We found short term street parking so we could check-in, and I could go park my car later. In Lost Horizon by James Hilton, Shangri-la is tucked away in the mountains of tibet. Well the entrance to the main lobby, and check-in is follows that basic concept. The entrance is not on Georgia, but tucked away on Alberni with only a small sign leading the way; Shangri-la and an arrow pointing to the right and into a winding driveway down to the lower lobby where you check-in. However my girlfriend and I entered off of Georgia, next to the burberry shoppe, you are welcomed by two fu dog statues guarding the place (how very asian). Inside of the Lobby (off of Georgia street) is the concierge desk, some seating areas, Xi-Shi lounge and two sets of lifts (elevators). No lobby in sight!!!, as I mentioned there are two sets of lifts one for the residences called "living Shangri-la" and another set of elevators marked hotel lifts. We took it down to the lower lobby for the front desk (this is the driveway entrance off of Georgia). The lobby is small, very elegant, and decorated in an asian motiff (like the rest of the hotel). The key card is unlike most other key cards at most hotels (you also have to use key card in the elevator to get to your floor), you don't slide the card into a stupid slot until the light turns green and remove to gain access into your room, no this is a little different. The difference is you tap a sensor on the door to gain entry into your room. We're not finished with the key card just yet. You need to insert the key card into a slot by the door to activate the lights in the room. Ohh boy!!! and when the lights do come on, you have reached Shangri-la...the paradise on earth. We were staying through a Sunday and on sundays shoppes open late, and close early and my g/f and I for the first time couldn't wait to just relax in the room!! Ok so first everything is electronic from the light switches (complete with various settings; sconce, nightlight, reading light etc.etc.) to the controls for the shades and the blinds so you don't have to get up to close either, just the touch of a button. There was also a control panel for the do not disturb so when you pressed it a pad on the outside of the room lit up in red "do not disturb" and would turn off the doorbell if someone rang. There were also some goodies left in the room; on the coffee table a note from the manager welcoming guests personally (whether it was handwritten or not, a very nice gesture) thank you Richard. Next to the note was a plate of fruit, and on the bed each night laid a bookmark, and a small piece of candy wrapped in plastic (each night had a different morsel of candy from salted caramel, caramel, and a grape soft chew). The bed was a queen size bed and the best part about it was that the throw pillows, and throw blanket were tucked away in the drawer under the television. The only pillows and blankets was a very warm alternative down comforter and probably the most pillow selection types ever on a hotel bed (there is even a card in the night stand with different pillow choices that you could leave out and the staff would bring those pillows). The other treasure in the other night stand was a copy of not the bible, but James Hilton's Lost Horizon (some properties offer a complementary copy, Vancouver location does not!!! I asked, its 20 dollars) the novel in which Shangri-la originated from. The television had just a great selection of channels and movie selections, but the most unique part of the television amenities was that it had a a DVD player, and ability to hook-up an Xbox, or PS2/3 for video game console playing. Another great part of the room and it seems endless but the WIFI in the rooms are FREE!!! and quite fast (BEST THING) because we both had work to do on our laptops so that is great and more hotels should offer free WIFI in the room and not be a pay thing or free in the lobby bologna. The closet had ample space with drawers, umbrellas, shoe horn, and a safe. The mini-bar was quite extensive, and they also have those stupid, wasteful, hateful nespresso single serve coffee machines (which have become popular for reasons I don't understand). To make it up they have complimentary slippers and bathrobes for use. For me the piece du resistance.....the loo, the bathroom, the john. No!!! those terms do not do it justice. The bathroom is a cathedral of cleanliness and marble. Yes white marble floors and walls. There was a private toilet room with sliding glass doors, a little shelf, and a telephone (a very private and lovely feature). The shower was large and a little confusing at first to use, because there is one lever and the way you turn either activates the wall mounted shower head or the hand held shower head. The bathtub was large and deep great for soaking in a warm bath (downside no bath bubbles or bath gel), I still soaked in the tub many many times. The blinds are even controlled by switch on the wall. Next to the sink I had noticed a remote control and thought to myself what could this be?? I hit the power button and on came the mini-television in the mirror, let me repeat that a mini television built into the bathroom wall mirror, I kid you not. L'occitane is the supplier of their bath gels, soaps, shampoos and conditioners (great stuff), they also have two toothbrushes with mini-toothpaste supplied in the bathroom. Overall, a pretty sweet bathroom err....cathedral. We didn't use the pool, or the hot tub or the fitness centre, but the pool is on the 5th or 6th floor (i don't remember) I checked it out and it is heated so even on chilly days its nice to go swimming. They have a world class spa called, Chi which we didn't use, 24 hour room service (very nice) but didn't use. They have a company car for guests to reserve and get chauffeured in (i think a mercedes S-class) but didn't use. So all the world class service and amenities of a 1st rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: reviews255057
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. I arrived at 0700, check in wasn't until 1500 but I was treated like a queen whilst I waited for my room. The staff were brilliant and pointed me in the right direction of the best coffee house and shops on Robson st. I was allows to sit by the open fireplace in the foyer and read until the room was available. My room was excellent, very large with an extremely comfortable King size bed as booked. the bathroom was sensational and very clean. TV over the bath if you wish to indulge. Room also has a balcony with table and chairs. Great view over the city and mountains. We received a complimentary fruit plate upon arrival. I would definitely recommend this hotel - outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: Karin L
Reviews.Content: Came here for with my husband and two children (ages 5 and 6) to celebrate our son's birthday. This was our first time in Vancouver, so I'm going to mention distances and timelines in this for those who are like us - not sure exactly where things are located and how to get there. First, the entrance IS tough to find - it is on Alberni and NOT on Georgia - just look for the small sign that points to go down into what looks like a parking garage. We were greeted by a bellhop and a staff member who immediately checked us in - and upgraded us to an executive suite (incredible!). The room was amazing - king bed with a pull-out sofa - very roomy even with the sofabed out - and floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking downtown. Everything push-button and very high-tech, so the kids loved it. The only issue we had was that while we were unpacking, they sent up a tray of different kids of homemade cookies and fruit as a greeting with a hand-written note from the manager (thank you, Richard, very nice touch). After being assured by the staff person that the cookies did not have nuts in them as so many people are allergic these days (our kids are severely allergic), our kids dove at the cookies. My husband noticed one of the cookies looked like peanut butter and tasted it (and it seemed like peanuts). Grabbing our kids and having them spit out anything they had in their mouths (thank goodness the one they chose was chocolate chip), we called the service and they checked - turned out that although they normally NEVER put nuts in the cookies, today of all days they added peanut butter cookies to the tray. The apologized profusely and asked if we could wait 20 minutes and they would send us an entirely fresh-baked tray - which arrived exactly 20 minutes later with more fruit and more apologies from the staff, who were appalled that that had happened. We write this not to be critical of the hotel, but of how well they handled what was a pretty scary situation for our kids. The concierge (Jeffrey - he was fabulous!) gave us a great map, a handout (Kids Guide?) of all the kids activities around vancouver, and got us reservations at Al Porto, an incredible Italian restaurant in the Gastown district. A quick 20 minute walk (with lots of stops by the waterfront) and down a cobble-stone alley, we were at Al Porto - seated immediately (think busy Italian restaurant with cosy ambiance). Service was outstanding (the salad with walnut-encrusted goat cheese, gnocchi, fettucini alfredo and beef tenderloin were great, but the BEST was the sautéed mushrooms in tarragon and garlic - highly recommend it)! A bonus about this hotel is that there is a great market called Urban Fare that is right behind the hotel - made for a great place to get fruit, amazing croissants and coffee every morning. The cheese section is incredible, as well! Also, Robson street is truly 1 block away - this hotel is in an excellent location! Day 2, we decided to go to the aquarium - while it is a 30 min walk (for an adult), 2 kids and rain seemed to make the decision to do a cab easier. The concierge again was great - called us a cab and gave us discount vouchers for entrance. Aquarium was great - beluga show and dolphin show were close in location and distance so we could do both. We were pleasantly surprised to find that they have snakes and a whole amazon section, as well, so note that it is not just aquatic life! We lunched at The Market (at the hotel) - the market burger with brie and truffle sauce was outstanding. Grabbed coffee again at Urban Fare and walked Robson Street, then back to the hotel to swim. NOTE - the pool is outside, but "heated" - considering it was about 4 celsius, we decided to opt for the hot tub, which was a great temperature for the kids. I will say, I think the part of this hotel that has trumped all else for the kids is being able to watch 'Ice Age' on the TV in the mirror in the bathroom while showering after the hot tub. Our kids have determined that they are never leaving this hotel :) As a comment about what we read about having to call for ice - yes, you do. But the longest it ever took for ice to arrive for us was 2 minutes. We honestly can't enough about this hotel - the amenities, location and most of all - the STAFF - are absolutely incredible. Best hotel we have stayed in - hands down. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Chi Spa at Shangri-La Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Jgirl007
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver and my husband and I spa together on a regular basis. The Chi Spa at the Shangri-La hotel is our favorite in the city (apart from the Mirage on S. Granville). We prefer it to the newer Willow Stream Spa at the Fairmint Pacific Rim. No detail was left undone in the interior. The signature Chi Massage is more of an energy balance than deep tissue and totally worth experiencing if relaxation is your preference. the Japanese masseuses are consistently excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good, better, Shangri-la!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nis N
Reviews.Content: Shangri-la exceeded my expectations for a hotel. I've traveled a lot in the world, Tokyo, Tel-Aviv, Prague and Berlin alone this year and have stayed at 5 star hotels HOWEVER: Shangri-la beats it all Everything is just a bit better. (or a lot) In addition, authentic and beautiful art on the walls Shangri-la Vancouver is perfectly Placed. Walking distance to everything. The staff are friendly, helpful and very welcoming. Just opposite the hotel there is a sushi restaurant; Ki which I also can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelMamaCita_16
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed an overnight stay with my family, including our dog. The hotel and staff ensure all amenities are provided including a dog bed, bowls and water for the pooch. Dinner at XiShi Lounge was delicious with great live entertainment as well. For me, the highlight was the WestCoast Wave massage at Chi Spa. The therapist used the perfect amount of pressure and even worked on areas of stress I didn't realize I was carrying. The atmosphere in the spa and in the client room was so tranquil. The experience from start to finish was incredible. The Shangri-la is as its namesake describes: a paradise on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Excellent Service, High Tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: Egypt6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a business trip and have to say this is one of the most state-of-the-art hotels where I have stayed. Everything is automated, and I was amazed by the presence of the tv screen in the bathroom mirror. The staff treated me like royalty, and everyone was more than willing to help with every request I had related to our board's group stay, including when I walked into the business center and found someone to help me print some documents on the fly. I cannot say enough about how polite and helpful everyone was, and what a nice element this is when you have a lot to accomplish in a short time with a large group. I wrote out the comment card and I know it was read, because they sent me a nice desk calendar to boot. VERY pleased and now I understand why my company loves this hotel. Best stay ever--I wish it could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EL_Oslo
Reviews.Content: Suberb service, a true Shangri La experience. The bed was probably the best hotel bed that I have ever slept in, even better than my own Hästens bed at home. Clean, stylish, quiet and sophisticated without being posh. Well worth the money, indeed. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, luxurious, so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy045Canada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and will stay again. It is so fun & wonderful to stay at a top notch hotel. The tv mirror in the bathroom is awesome! Fresh delicious coffee! Comfortable bed! And everything (lights, drapes open & close etc) is right at your fingertips!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant home environment”
Reviews.Author: MaryRingwald
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Shanri-La Hotel Vancouver exceeded my vision of a weekend get-a-way. It truly was my shangri-la. Thanks so much to everyone who made our stay a dream realized. Mary Ringwald

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: Ergi13
Reviews.Content: Everything is excellent about this hotel, but what puts it over the top is the staff and the amazing service they provide. The maid would even fold my t-shirts and lay them down properly. You find fruit in your room when you arrive accompanied by hand-written notes to welcome you. The rooms are spacious, modern and of course brand new. The location is excellent ad a walking distance to most places in downtown Vancouver. I was there for a business trip and the rate my company gets is excellent, which makes the overall value great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: From the first hello to the final goodbye, this hotel never ceased to amaze me. The facilities are gorgeous, with automated adjustable lighting, automated drapes for the windows, bathrooms with large tubs, walk in showers, bathroom mirrors with TV's, and large flat screen TVs in the bedroom. The 6th floor conference facilities are beautiful as well, really offering a high level of sofistication and elegance. The room service menus and on-site restaurants offer a mix of typical fare as well as asian specialties such as chicken wonton soups. The food is excellent in room and in the lounge or restaurant. The staff makes you feel special, and like you are cared for away from home. Small touches like a newspaper every morning, an evening turn down service with a bottle of water and chocolate, a staff member organizing my makeup on a nice linen cloth when I'd left it disorganized, and similar made it feel kind and welcoming. The hotel is well located in downtown Vancouver, with a lot of food and shopping options very nearby. The hotel even has a flight check in kiosk just like the airports, that will print your boarding passes right on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Justindyer5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying over in Vancouver for the night and we had heard the shangri-la was nice so we thought we would try it out. From the moment we were greeted to the time we left we were treated like royalty. The entire hotel is spotless and the service is extraordinary. We walked from the hotel to hy's steakhouse for dinner and then back to the hotel for cocktails in the hotel bar. Great cocktail menu and even though the cocktails were a bit pricey, they were what you would expect in a hotel bar. Overall our stay was spectacular and I would definitely stay there again. Especially if it is a special occasion. It was our anniversary and they brought us chocolate covered strawberries.....on the house!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Ryogen T
Reviews.Content: For many years, the Shangri-La Hotel chain has been the number one choice for our family for its quality. The Vancouver Shangri-La is the best of the best in my opinion. If you're looking for a conveniently located, new and a high quality hotel then this is it. Out of all the hotels I've stayed at, this one was truly the best, better than any other hotels in its chain. It's definitely the place of choice when visiting Vancouver as its location is close to everything, located near the Robson Street, Pacific Mall and a little walk down to the waterfront. The moment you walk into the hotel, the "Shangri-La smell" welcomes you and it's just a wonderful experience until the moment you leave the hotel. Will be visiting again in April.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Bliss”
Reviews.Author: DalianEx-pat
Reviews.Content: We discovered Shangri-La while living in Asia during the past four years. This chain was always our "go to" choice. Now that we are back in Canada we chose the Shangri-La as our Christmas retreat, and that it was. We spent six nights here and right from the get-go we were addressed by name wherever we went within the hotel, found that all services were discreetly handled with professionalism, and that staff seemed to appear and evaporate whenever needed or not. Unlike many of the chain's properties in Asia, this Vancouver hotel is small, intimate, not pretentious, and quietly elegant. Restaurant service was beyond expectations and Christmas dinner was the ultimate and at an extremely resonable cost of $65 for a four course meal. That, along with the wine pairing, was a perfect reason to spend Christmas in the Shangri-La. We will return for next Christmas! Of course, we will return before then, whenever we are in Vancouver. Do try the French Toast for breakfast - the most decadent thing imaginable!

Reviews.Title: “A Night of Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Corisa B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two friends spent the night to celebrate our anniversaries. This hotel feels like a luxury from the moment you enter. The staff was attentive from the moment of our arrival, so pleasant and personable. The room was chic and we mentally noted how equipped it was if we ever needed a place to stay for business purposes. A full desk was in each of our rooms with every kind of electronic plug-in you could need. The bathrooms were lovely with a full shower and a soaker tub. The bed was quite possibly the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in – it felt like a cloud. We would absolutely stay here again, and now I have a goal to travel to many of the Shang-ri La locations around the world and see what the other locations are like!

Reviews.Title: “Top property in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: greg h
Reviews.Content: Appreciated the privacy and the low intensity of the rooms. Very few rooms and you rarely see or hear staff or other guests. Rooms are perfect in Shangri-la style. had a great 4 days there in December 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, but a few mis-steps”
Reviews.Author: Pomonan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in August 2011. We had a few niggles, but nothing severe enough to drop this review to a 4. Service was outstanding. We had a problem with our initial room, and were kindly moved to a one-bedroom suite with balcony, which inevitably colours our review. The room was genuinely a luxury experience - a step above similar accommodation we have had in Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton properties in the US. The mis-steps were as follows: The hotel had arranged a driver from YVR, who duly met our flight as arranged, but had managed to lose his car keys. Fortunately he was still able to get into and start the car, but any amusement faded when we stopped not once but twice so he could tie down the trunk with his belt. This added significantly to our journey time, not ideal coming in at midnight from Las Vegas. Market at Jean-Georges was hit and miss, or to be more precise as breakfast was included in our rate: miss-hit-miss-miss (the fifth day we had a dawn train to Seattle; the hotel kindly provided pastries and fruit (which was then confiscated by Customs at the station)). As I think someone else pointed out, a lot depends on your server - maybe we were just unlucky 75% of the time. However, we experienced similar service issues at several restaurants; maybe it's a Vancouver thing. My final gripe is being charged $12 for an espresso by the pool. It was from a automatic machine and not even any good. Overall, however, an experience I would recommend, and would probably stay here again if in Vancouver. The pool was a bonus (though not exactly a sun-trap) and we used Chi Spa which was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Proposal Night”
Reviews.Author: Vincent M
Reviews.Content: The men and women at this hotel made our stay the most memorable night in our lives. They were the most accommodating, kind and understanding people we've ever met. The room that I got was the Deluxe One Bedroom Suite. As soon as I got in our room, my initial reaction was "wow, this will truly be a luxury experience" - and it was. My favorite part of the room is the bathroom, complete with jet soaker, rain shower and oh, a tv in the mirror. We will definitely be coming back and if possible, maybe get the same room number. Thank you Shangri-La for making Dec. 27th a very special night. You guys are the best in town!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: StarSeekR
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful & well appointed. Beds (including Pull Out) were comfortable. Spacious bathroom with modern touches. Attentive service delivered with elegance. Chi Spa is worth a visit. It was completely booked during our stay, so it will have to wait until next time. Great downtown location, walkable distance to entertainment & dining. A great way to endulge while on business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverblackf4i
Reviews.Content: This was the third year in a row we stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel in Vancouver for Xmas. First year we got upgraded to an extremely nice corner suite, past two years we've been in the Deluxe rooms with king beds. The service is friendly, accommodating of requests, and very helpful overall. The room decor is relaxing and tranquil, the bathrooms are well designed, fast hot water and excellent plumbing, lights on dimmers, TV-in-mirror, frosted glass partition on commode. The beds (Stearns & Foster mattresses) and bedding materials are extremely comfortable - easily the best I've ever slept in. Heavy drapes and sheer curtains are independently controlled via electronic controls, bedroom lights are all on dimmers with controls located next to both sides of the bed. The rooms we stayed in had a safe in the closet large enough to hold a 15-inch laptop, also includes a jewelry tray. The location is basically at the center of downtown give or take a couple of blocks, with easy access to a variety of restaurants, shopping, lounges, and public transportation. Stanley Park is a 15 minute walk to the northwest. Convenience items - there is an Urban Fare (upscale deli/grocery store combo) next door, a Tim Horton's, Wendy's, and A&W across the street, a 7-11 adjacent, and a well stocked liquor store a block away. The hotel's parking lot is a bit tricky to find for first-timers, almost like a secret back entrance off of Alberni Street just past the Urban Fare.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tdh123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we got a good deal since we were attending a Christmas Party. Fancy hotels are not really our thing, but this place was well worth the rate we paid. The rooms were very well designed, the beds were comfy and the location is excellent. If you are looking for a top notch experience in a hotel with a Zen environment, this is a good place to stay. One complaint I had was there were no ice machines that I could find so I ended up buying ice from 7-11 which was not a normal experience for me. I am sure I could have called down and asked for some, however it was easier to pick up on my way back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: mitchmac
Reviews.Content: We have travelled the world and our stays at the Shangra-La in Vancouver rival any hotel in the world. we were fortunate enough to attend the Canadian Tenors package at the hotel. It was a great experience. from the minute you walk in to the time you leave, you are made to feel like you are their most important guest! A truly wonderful experience that we would recommend to anyone for the night away to that special date!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever been.”
Reviews.Author: Alexanderplatz1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in September 2010 for a week. Beginning with a hotel car picking me up at YVR, following with a warm welcome and a fantastic room with balcony on the 15th floor (I think), I really felt at home. The staff at the restaurant were extremely polite and the concierge arranged a trip to Victoria for me. So thank you very much for such a good service. Even after I checked out the staff were there for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ended up chaning Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mr_and_mrs_nibbles
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we have stayed at the Shangri La a few times before and my parents have too. Always been a great experience.... However, we booked our 'annual' night out in Vancouver this year. I'm sure I chose a King online, but maybe I didn't. Anyway, realized and phoned up to change. Said no problem, will get a confirmation email. Worked away for a week, then remembered no email, called and we had been wait-listed to a King, which was different to have previously been advised. Ended up in a Twin, not the end of the world though and possibly my mistake. However, when checking in my wife overheard someone else being told all the restaraunts and bars were booked up for private function and NO WHERE was available in this hotel to drink. Phoned reception, this was confirmed, no Apology until we phoned back and complained and then given different bars which they could book (we later found out 2 of the 3 dont take bar bookings anyway). Cut a long story short, they really didnt care that we wanted drinks in this ($350) expensive hotel before we went out with a meal with friends, so we changed Hotels. Ended up a block or two away at a Hotel we've stayed at before 60% of the drive, much bigger room and fantastic service who accommodated us at short notice. And with that, the Shangri-La has lost mine and my families business (which was 4 different occasions in the past 12 months)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margo M
Reviews.Content: I have and do travel and have stayed in many hotels but this is the first hotel that I can say I have enjoyed the most and there wasn't even one problem. The rooms are beautiful, airy, comfortable and come with everything you need. The beds and bedding are like sleeping in a cloud!! The bathrooms are surrounded in a white marble giving a feeling of spaciousness and relaxation. The staff are more than helpful to make your stay easy and comfortable and the service is impeccable. We thought we would be out dining on the Saturday night but decided to have room service and the food was amazing! I must add that the restaurant, bar/lounge are really good and the spa is fabulous as well. I left feeling happy, content and relaxed. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brianrg
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La is simply Vancouver's best hotel. I stay there almost every trip to Vancouver and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. From the moment I walk in the door to the time that I check out the service is impeccable. There is a great restaurant (The Market), fantastic lounge with incredible cocktails (Xi Shi Lounge) and an amazing spa (Chi). The size of the hotel is really misleading, I thought the hotel was a lot larger than it actually is. I believe the hotel only has rooms on Floors 8 through 15. The other 50+ floors are private residence. If you haven't stayed there you really should.

Reviews.Title: “Guests don't count”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: As I write this review I have had room service ringing in my ear for ten minutes with no answer. There is no lobby bar, they close their restaurants and two boring bars nightly for private functions with no regard for their guests. The room itself is quite nice, the maids are very sweet and flexible. Beyond that it is the worst experience I have ever had at an upscale hotel. If you are traveling to Vancouver on business I would recommend you choose any other hotel. Kind of a nightmare staying here.

Reviews.Title: “best place in town”
Reviews.Author: walNorthAmerica
Reviews.Content: Wonderful in every way: great rooms, best service in the world, nice gym and steam/sauna, wonderful food. We had a one bedroom suite - big with nice balcony. It is the above and beyond service, and the high standard of excellence, that really stand out here.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Vancouver !! The design is beautiful and the rooms are fantastic. The location is great. The service of the staff is unbeatable. Try the market restaurant if you can. The spa is also wonderful-- the fees are little high but it's worth it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: tmeizler
Reviews.Content: nice and quiete, very well located, good service. we had a suite - alittle bit small but clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “One night in heaven”
Reviews.Author: mike219jma
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my fiancee and we completely loved it. Please check out my full review here - http://infamousdx.com/2011/11/03/shangri-la-vancouver-hotel/

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip”
Reviews.Author: 32655Visitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel in late August. Vancouver is a very beautiful city and this is a very nice place to stay. We would be happy to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great support for business events”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: We held two separate events at this hotel. The planning crew were fabulous, and there was always a staff member present to assist. Everything was so smooth and unobtrusive. Did not stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harrydog44
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la chain is one of the best collection of city hotels in the world. This one is no exception. The suite we had was beautifully appointed, stocked with first-rate amenities, and very comfortable bed and furniture. The Market Restaurant was a Michelin One Star, and was well worthy of that rating. The service was up to the usual impeccable standard of the chain. The only cavil is that the hotel is located on the lower floors of the tallest building in Vancouver, and is very difficult to access. The only vehicle entrance is through a parking garage that is accessed via a street that is perpendicular to the street of the hotel's address. Cab drivers consistently had difficulty finding it. The entrance to the hotel through the parking garage is, to put it mildly, less than dramatic. The Shangri-la is an excellent choice for a business hotel in Vancouver, but for truly personal service, I prefer the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: gal_businesstraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing short of perfection. In room technology, style, staff service and more. I loved this hotel and can't wait to be back. Those that don't travel often or don't truly appreciate this "little" details that mean all the world to a road warrior, might not appreciate the subtle nuances.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great :(”
Reviews.Author: Aprilp2412
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a top notch hotel like the Shangri-La before. So I am not being snobby when I say I was disappointed. We wanted to stay at a great place for our honeymoon so paid the high price and booked this hotel. Yes, the rooms were nice but not very large. My issue is that for the price I expected more, I dont think the hotel was any better than any of the mid priced hotels. We did not have any issues, but nothing great to say either. But we loved our meal at MARKET!

Reviews.Title: “Average all around, just paying for the NAME!”
Reviews.Author: SGO007
Reviews.Content: I was there for a wedding and decided to pay the big ticketed price for location. Having heard wonderful things about Shangri-La hotels, I was expecting great room with amazing service. The hotel is very nice and the rooms were very clean but for double the price of other five star hotels, I was not impressed. I think we are just paying for the brand. The Good: - Very Clean - Great location - Nice sized bathroom. The not so good: - Check in was slow (No in room check in) - Service was average. - For the price they did not go the extra mile to help. My friends and I have booked two rooms and they put one of us on separate floors and we asked if we can be moved to the same floor. I talked to the house keeper and they inform me that the room across from my room was free but upon inquiring at the front desk they wanted more money, considering we are paying close to $1000 for two rooms and we were there for a wedding (I am sure tens of thousands of income), they would not help us unless we pay additional fee ($30). They hotel value money over happy guest, it's just bad business for not offer a non-booked room to make guests happy. They lost a few repeat customer that day. With so many other hotels near by I woukld stay somewhere else and get a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sailaway1002
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this specific shangri la and once again it did not disappoint. Rooms are amazingly clean, large, modern asian decor and extremely cozy. Staff was super friendly and always a pleasure to look at as very elegantly dressed. Gym is a little small but still well equipped with some cardio and weights. Pool is very small. It is on the upper end $ wise but definitley worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here everytime i visit vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Cindy E
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, very secure and views were georgous. The room was awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Lkm995
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks here last year and re visit again. Rooms are wonderful but I don't think the ones with balconies make that much of a difference because of the surrounding building a are rather ugly, such a parking garage and some unsightly grey concrete and sign boards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pimped out room!”
Reviews.Author: lewis01utk
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Shangri-La hotel in transit to an Alaskan cruise my wife and i were taking. We booked the room through the American Express FHR program. To start with the hotel is more on the small size of the high rise hotels. The hotel rooms occupy the first 15 floors with luxury condos on the rest. The staff were very helpful and the front desk staff (on the lower level than the street level) were very nice and quick regarding checkin. They complementary upgraded our room to a balcony suite. This room was incredible! Very modern and luxurious with quite a few high tech ad ons such as push button drapes and dimming lights. The room was very clean and well kept as was the rest of the decor. The work out facilities where top of the line and very nice. The restaurant, Market, was great. We ate breakfast there the next morning. The apricot sausage was phenomenal! In the process of eating I managed to dump my coke all over myself. The restaurant manager, Gordon Hay, was near and came over to assist, switching chairs, picking up ice from everywhere and even had the chef retire some new food due to my original food having coke on it. We started talking to Mr Hay and he was a real wealth of knowledge regarding the local area and took the time to locate a map and answer our tourist questions as well as make some local recommendations as to what to do in the area. He was very personable and helpful and was a true crowning touch to the overall great experience of the hotel. We would definitely stay again and recommend the Shangri-La to anyone coming to vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: mistralksk
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of hotel in which you feel that you stay in a five starts. Every detail in the rooms and the bathrooms has been perfectly cared. Breakfast is not a buffet, and it could be improved, but waiters try to satisfy you in any thing you ask them.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: abott
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, the service, the rooms, the downtown location! This has to be one of the best hotel experiences I have had in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Maximilan
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, but very poor breakfast. Very limited menu, no buffet and extremely expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: TUCK1995
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here last week and were thoroughly impressed. Rooms are extremely well appointed, service excellent, the facilities are top notch and the location is super convenient. One particularly nice feature was that we had two adjoining rooms that were attached by closing off the end of a hallway, which provided a suite feeling, but with additional privacy and security. Also impressive that they don't try to nickel and dime you on every ancillary service (e.g., very high quality free internet, no hassle on late check out, complementary coffee in room). Most recent comparable experience was at the Peninsula in Tokyo. First time we've ever stayed in a Shangri-La, but probably not the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: ridgebackfan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Shangri-La Hotels all over the world in the past several years and this hotel met or exceeded every one of my expectations. This hotel occupies the first 14 floors of Vancouver's current tallest building. The thing that stands out the most about it is the service. Everyone, from the front desk to the concierge, housekeeping and in the restaurant, has been so kind, very efficient and very helpful. The rooms sparkle. I love the floor to ceiling windows. We've made great use of the balcony in our executive room. The bedding is very comfortable. The bath and bathroom are wonderful. The food in the restaurant is superb. The gym is well-equipped and user friendly. I would definitely return (with our without a Horizon Club...didn't impact my stay one bit). The location is great. A gourmet grocery is next door (Urban Fare), and the liquor store is just around the corner. It's an easy walk to the water on three sides of downtown, and a few blocks to the Canada Line Sky Tram.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: doobeebaby
Reviews.Content: The Asian hospitality was evident and we were treated very well by everyone at this small hotel hidden away in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are very well appointed with no expenses spares (TV in bathroom behind the vanity mirror, electric curtains, in-room Nespresso machine, complementary bottle water). This is a true 5-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Co-Pilotin
Reviews.Content: On our four week around British Columbia and Alberta we stayed at the Shangri-La three times (two nights / three nights/ one night) and it was spectacular. The service is excellent. When we arrived the first time we were asked where our trip would take us next and 30 minutes later we had directions and a weather forecast sent to our room. The rooms were all immaculate and the view overlooking the city of Vancouver was great. (It is after all the tallest building in town). The hotel is easy to get to by car from the airport or the highway and as there's an underground garage with a second lobby you can check in easily. As the hotel is close to the city center, shops, museums, Stanley Park etc, you don't need the car while staying in Vancouver. Whenever we had a questions or an inquiry we were being helped at once. There would've been a very nice spa and there's a gym which is well equipped and open 24/7. The food is Asia meets the West and you can chose between different breakfast options. Many people staying and working at the Shangri-La are Asian and the furniture and art in rooms and the hotel make it feel as if you were in a luxury hotel in Shanghai. We've seen a few placed so far but this was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “The worst SL I´ve been to as a Diamond....”
Reviews.Author: Bad-runner
Reviews.Content: Those who praised this one must have´nt been to any other SL before. As a diamond member, I have been to at least three other SL. The worst part of this one is´nt really the missing of the in-room check-in, it´s the missing of the Horizon Club - without happy hour. They say it´s due to the certain ban on serving alcohol by th BC legistlation!? ..similar to the Saudi Arabia?? Will definitely no return..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an executive suite room for a week while in Vancouver recently and was very impressed with the hotel overall. The room was amazing, modern and a touch oriental, with every amenity included. It even had a lighting system for every room and electric drapes and blinds. The room was huge as was the bathroom. Service was excellent in every way. The parking was a bit hard to find, you need to actually go onto the street behind the hotel and then half way down the block is an entrance that takes you under the hotel to where there is a lower lobby. There is another lobby at street level. The location of the hotel is perfect as well, right near Robson street with many great restaurants in easy walking distance. I have stayed in many hotels in Vancover and this has become my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ScottishVoyageur
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here and enjoyed our stay. A high class establishment which deserves its reputation for quality. Modern decor, excellent helpful staff. Loved the piano bar. Vancouver is a great city and this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - but Fairmont Pacific Rim is better”
Reviews.Author: talula001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in different hotels during my prolonged stay in Vancouver. The Shanri-La is a top hotel, no doubt about it, and it feels very luxurious, so I totally agree with all other reviews that give the Shangri La a very good to excellent score. The staff is very friendly, and the rooms are large and nicely decorated. I also recommend their restaurant for dinner : delicious !!! Unfortunately, it cannot beat the Pacific Rim because the latter scores better on some points : - location : the Shangri La occupies the lower 15 floors of the tallest skyscraper of Vancouver in the middle of the city, so the rooms offer some view on the streets below. However, the new Fairmont Pacific Rim is located at the water edge, with tremendous views on Burrard Inlet and the possibility of a nice stroll along the water. - swimming pool & hottube is larger and nicer at Fairmont Pacific Rim - the room felt more spacious and modern at Fairmont Pacific Rim All in all, you cannot go wrong with the Shangri La Vancouver, but if you have the choice, go for the Fairmont Pacific Rim instead, which must be one of the best city hotels I ever encountered in the world (see my seperate review on them)

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service, luxury worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Timbo_82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive balcony king suite on the 12th floor for 4 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. The hotel is very central, walking distance from most of Vancouver's significant attractions and in an area where we felt safe and comfortable. First and foremost we found the service absolutely excellent. The staff were chomping at the bit to go the extra mile to make our stay perfect. On the first day my wife realised she had left her contact lenses at home. One word to the concierge and they had called around several opticians and found us one of the few that was open on a public holiday. We asked them to reserve us a place for dinner at the restaurant on our way out one day and on returning had a full confirmation letter on printed on hallmarked paper and a telephone message just to make sure! The lobby is very plush but also quite modern. The corridors around the room were all clad in beautiful dark mahogany. The fittings in the room oozed quality and the view was superb, especially at night. The attention to detail in cleaning and room service was again excellent, every day of our stay the room looked perfect. We will definitely be back, we felt this was a great place to start our honeymoon and would recommended it highly to anybody looking for a real luxury experience in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “service was mixed, would not come back”
Reviews.Author: derck0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Shangri La and were welcomed in a proffesional way that impressed us all. The servicein teh hotel is very good, however on the first afternoon our daughter stepped in a small piece of glass causing her foot to bleed. I called and the response was that they did sent up a safety person with a first aid kit. You woudl expect that they woudl clean and vacuum the room to prevent a repeat. This did not happen, we got however a piece of chocolate cake for our daughter. We had dinner in teh hotel restaurant, service was again good, food not too special, have been in hotels that offer a more special selection and preparation. We stayed three nights, the last mnonting we had too leave early, on the other two days we returned to our room at 15:30 and our room was still not cleaned, again not a service I woudl expect from a hotel with this reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: SDG_Business
Reviews.Content: We hosted a two national conference at the Shangri-La in May and I have to say I was extremely impressed by their attention to detail. Every little thing was taken care of, there was always someone close at hand to answer questions or tend to any needs we had. From signing the contract with Josh and Joyce to dealing with Tyler the Chef, I was impressed by every member of the staff. Each and every person went out of their way to ensure that our conference went off without a hitch. I definitely would recommend the Shangri-La a place for business travel and conferences. All the out of town guests were amazed by how beautiful the rooms were and again how there was such an attention to detail with everything. Overall, it was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: navsterangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed twice at the Shangri-La. It is definitely pricey, but once you stay there, you know why. It is absolute luxury, the rooms are amazing, beautifully decorated and very spacious. The service at this hotel is above anything I ever have seen. My husband just happened to mention while booking that it was our anniversary, and when we arrived in our room there was a large bottle of champagne on ice and yummy desert waiting for us. They really go above and beyond and there's been a note from the manager welcoming us both times. The second time we went, we got a couples package which included a couples massage in their spa, that was amazing too, but probably wouldn't have done it if we had paid separately for it (VERY expensive). The location is great too, near Robson and lots of other restaurants. Had breakfast both times in the on-site restaurant, very delicious and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at its best...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mar06252
Reviews.Content: Even one night experience in such a grand hotel makes you want to strive for all that is out there in life to enjoy. To be treated with such excellence makes one feel more than special. There was absolutely nothing to complain about this hotel, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “This is an outstanding hotel in a spectacular city.”
Reviews.Author: ppanessa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is first class in all aspects. It is located in the heart of the city, close to everything. The furnishings are state of the art and the service is exceptional in all areas. "Market" restaurant is one of the very finest with high end service, quality and outstanding food. The chef is reknouned, and with good reason. It's the perfect restaurant for the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the city”
Reviews.Author: nicoleprodoffice
Reviews.Content: Had a girls' getaway and stayed in a beautiful room. The bathrooms are spacious and GORGEOUS. Nice touch are the Nespresso machines to make coffee, and the location can't be beat. A block away from the best shopping in the city. Everything is stumbling distance and the staff are very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Hotel, Vancouver AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: fawnmc
Reviews.Content: The new Shangri-La Hotel, Vancouver is just a fantastic property. The entire stay was an experience more than just a hotel room. The spa is especailly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Horizon has been found at Shangri-La Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Chanelno3
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in an Executive suite on the 8th floor (rm 811). Massive corner room with a sitting area, generous bathroom double sinks, huge bed, wet bar nespresso coffee machine, mini foyer, and walk-in closet. The swipe card is your key to everything electronic in the room. Nothing is on or off - everything gently opens (the sheers and drapes) or softly comes up (the lights in the bathroom or at the spacious desk). Coolest light: the nigh light at ground level under both bed sides tables. Very helpful. Massive marble bathroom, amazing tub, 3/4 floor to ceiling windows. A balcony that is protected from the wind and rain but yet offers some Vancouver / ocean fresh air. Stellar walk-in closet which conjures old Shanghai with a real clothes brush, extended wooden shoe horn, and a real garment bag made of cloth. Safe with a felt-lined jewelry tray. Pocket doors, magnetic door hardware that once touching will trigger the light to turn off. The main entrance way to the hotel is on Georgia which cannot be used if you're arriving by car - weird. If you have a car, the entrance way is mid-Alberni on the north side sort of hidden but obvious once you zip past it about three times :) I have to say even though the car drop-off area and check-in works, it's a little odd arriving at the beautiful Shangri-la via the basement in a crumby car park. Walking around: lots to do - Tiffany's, Chanel, Brooks Brothers, JJ Bean, sushi, liquor store, church, banks, all in the area. Staff: so exotic, polite, helpful, gracious, with a great combination of style and a sense of humour. Dog: (dog must be under 50lbs) I had my miniature poodle with me. No problems. The hotel welcomed him: dog bed, dog bowls, and dog-love. Word for your dog, there are no green spaces within 7 blocks. Closest official dog park is at Nelson and Thurlow otherwise it's tree wells on your way to JJ Bean for a mocha. Sorry pooch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, tranquil and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: ddly
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Hotel is an oasis in downtown Vancouver. Elegant rooms, attentive service and a very tranquil atmosphere. The perfect get-away.

Reviews.Title: “First class accommodations bested only by an attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Josh_Franklin
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of enjoying the excellent accommodations for an overnight business stay. The room was very well appointed, had excellent views out of floor to ceiling windows and was a very much appreciated respite from a long day. The room was bested only by the staff and their plesent demour and excellent suggestions to best enjoy the city. On a playoff hockey night in Vancouver the concierge was able to not only suggest an excellent restaurant but phoned ahead allowing me to walk directly in to a waiting table. I highly recommend the Shangr-La.

Reviews.Title: “Understated, 5-star opulance in a perfect downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: SF_FoodieFood
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights on a hybrid leisure & business trip, and we both thought the experience was wonderful. The hotel itself is typical Shangri-La in look & feel, meaning, it is a beautiful, unfussy, simply decorated, quiet and welcoming retreat with gracious staff members always aiming to please. The lobby is split into 2 floors, lower lobby for reception & transportation, the upper lobby on street level for concierge & meet-n-greet. It the perfect vibe for those that are looking for an understated, elegant, private getaway; for those that don't want that uber hip, trendy, club-like atmosphere; and for those that have no care about being in the center of a hustle-bustle, conspicious, see & be seen lobby (such as the Fairmont Pacific Place). No doubt celebs stay here, but you get the sense that the Shangri-La is all about discretion and focusing on nothing but an excellent guest experience. The hallways are this gorgeous, dark floor-to-ceiling wood (zebrawood or rosewood?), and the rooms themselves have lovely floor-to-ceiling marble in the bathroom, amazingly comfortable beds, and high-class but simple appointments throughout. We got a room with a huge balcony, which was too cold to use, but provided great city views onto Alberni street. Every staff member was A+, from Adrian (concierge) to Christine (housekeeping) to Jay (food & bev mgr). We are just regular John & Jane Doe, but they made us feel like VIPs all the way. Hope to find an affordable rate here the next time I'm up in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “This Shangri-La is Meh..”
Reviews.Author: MGohol
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a convention and they billet us at the Vancouver Shangri-la. Was not excepting a having to beg for toiletries/amenities at a 5 star hotel. Internet was super slow and I couldnt connect to our office VPN. No club lounge and breakfast at the cafe was slow and mediocre. Hotel was in a great location, I give them up and they do have comfortable beds it just some things are looking a little worn out and threadbare. The pool changing room was dirty and I tried the Chi Spa which I thought was grossly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classy with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: robert123London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one day stop-over in Vancouver on the way back from Whistler. The decor is modern, elegant and stylish, as one would expect, and the service equally stylish and professional. Our room was superb, a large twin, roomy, beautifully decorated and appointed, with a fabulous bathroom. The beds were amazingly comfortable. For the price, I would describe it as good value for money. We had a serious health issue in the middle of the night (nothing to do with the hotel) and they assisted us in the most caring manner, ensuring throughout that we had everything we needed, and that we were not troubled with extending bookings, late check outs etc., making us feel we were truly in the hands of professionals. Sometimes when things go wrong, you find out how good people really are and the staff at the Shangri-La did not fail us. A top-class and beautiful hotel with great staff at a sensible price - can one ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-Luxury - but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Sarasingh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year with my husband when they were having a $100 dining credit promotion. It was beautiful, everything is luxe luxe luxe, but it is VERY expensive as well. You are checked in in the room itself, which is a little strange but emblematic of the Shangri-La brand. If you travel often and are looking for something different - this is a fabulous choice. There is nothing quite like the Shangri-La. Just check out the front entrance!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tooheyspete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days pre Xmas and then again for a couple of days after New Years 2011. My wife and I like to do a lot of walking when holidaying in cities and the shangri la was so central it was easy to get back to no matter which direction you chose to go. Add to that Urban Fare a gourmet supermarket just out the back door and you had easy breakfast, lunch or dinner (we had a baby so sometimes this was a great option). Service was always friendly and sincere and the rooms were beautifully furnished. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience, highly recommened !”
Reviews.Author: Wingnutfilly
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is by far the best I have ever experienced. Our room was amazing; dinner at Market was fun, romantic and both our dinner and breakfast were incredible! We went and relaxed by the pool and the gentlemen working made us protein smoothies that were to die for ! I spilt on my white blazer at dinner and they dry cleaned it for me that evening and returned it to my room, that’s service! Overall this beautiful hotel is my fav in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “The Industry Standard”
Reviews.Author: Travelers974
Reviews.Content: The ambiance of the Shangri-La is luxurious and tranquil. The professionalism of the staff made us feel welcomed from beginning to end. We have stayed in many hotels all around the world and the Shangri-la has raised the bar for the industry. Our next Shangri-la experience cannot come soon enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Heavy scent ruins a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: visitingprof
Reviews.Content: There is nowhere to escape the heavy perfume piped into every corner of this otherwise beautiful hotel. It's not just that I'm allergic to some scents, and violently allergic to this one. It 's that customers should be informed, and have the right to choose. Though marketed as their 'signature', it's not even natural, but reeks of chemical fakery. A kindly member of cleaning staff showed me the hidden openable window and with the heat/air conditioning shut off, it was tolerable -- provided I didn't mind the freezing cold. To get to meetings, I held my breath and dashed through smelly elevators, hallways and lobbies, then retreated to my room for meals and (chilly) sleep. The beds, linens, amenities, room and bath are lovely. A major high-end hotel should have the courtesy to tell guests in advance about its perfume-permeated environment and give them a choice. Offer it on a particular floor, or in selected rooms. Don't ruin the entire hotel, and don't ruin my entire stay! Public places are now smoke-free; many are also scent-free. This is a wake-up call to management. You charged me a fortune for a room that was a misery and a hazard to my health!

Reviews.Title: “Sad to say...I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dragoneti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Vancouver for 4 nights in January 2011. I had originally paid for a superior room with twin beds and without breakfast on the hotel website, but they were nice enough to change it to the Winter Wonderland package upon request. This included breakfast ($60 credit/day for 2 pax). The cost was CD$347/night inclusive of taxes. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right in downtown Vancouver with Robson street, the main shopping area, just behind the hotel. However, the layout is unusual as the main reception is one floor below ground level. Tell your taxi driver to enter the underground carpark which is where you will find the entrance to the reception. This is great for people who want privacy. The doorman was efficient in opening the car door and getting our bags. The reception area was small and thus gave the feeling of a private check-in for guests. The receptionist was very welcoming, friendly and ushered us to the lift. The hotel is the tallest building in British Columbia and occupies the first 15 floors. Our room was located on the 14th floor. The room was of adequate size for a Superior room. The interior design was zen-like with chinese paintings on the walls. There was a hand written card from the manager welcoming us to the hotel which I thought was nice. We had a great view of the city surrounded by office buildings. The flat screen TV was the largest I had seen in any hotel room. You could control the intensity of the room lighting (instead of just on/off) but I found the room to be very dim; great for those who want to get some sleep! You could draw and open the blinds and curtains with the touch of a switch. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. The minibar was adequate with a nespresso coffee machine. They also provided welcome fruits (only on the first night), complimentary daily newspapers and free mineral water bottles during turn down service. The bathroom was almost all marble and was beautifully designed with the usual L’occitane bath products. The TV in the mirror was certainly a pleasant surprise! However, I felt that the bathroom was quite small (maybe because it was a superior room). There is complimentary internet in the room. Alternatively you could use the business centre with internet, fax and printing services. The Concierge is located on the street level which is where the hotel’s main lobby is located. This place felt more like the entrance to a private luxurious living room with a warm fireplace, large chandeliers and plush sofas. It didn’t look like your usual hotel lobby and you would never find large group of tourists hanging around. You really have to get acquainted with which entrances lead to the hotel lobby as we walked into the residential entrance and had to walk through a “maze” before we found the lifts to the hotel rooms. The main lobby entrance was very understated with 2 chinese lion statues at the revolving door. There was no doorman to welcome you. They really should have more staff in this area to attend to the guests as I felt that the Concierge was always busy. Before I arrived at the hotel, the Concierge was extremely helpful in providing information on day tours and booking transportation to Whistler. Communication was done efficiently via email. During my stay, the Concierge was helpful in pointing out the local sights and recommending dining options. They even had the restaurant menus! However, I felt that they could have taken it to the next level and have been more personal rather than just telling me information which I could google from the Internet if I had time. We had breakfast at the Market restaurant everyday. The service was great and one of the waitresses (she seemed like eastern european) was exceptionally friendly and talked to us about the weather and places of interest in Vancouver. The food was good, not exceptional. Don’t order the chinese breakfast. I didn’t like the french toast as it seemed as if the toast was deep fried and too sweet for my liking. The banana pancakes were great! What I didn’t like. The layout of the hotel is unusual as tour buses cannot stop anywhere along the hotel to pick you up. We had to wait for our Whistler coach at the Hyatt hotel which was a 10-15 minute walk away. When we asked the hotel how we could get there, they suggested walking there. I’m sure they could have considered the fact that we could have many pieces of luggage and dragging it all the way to the Hyatt in the horrible Vancouver rain wasn’t such a good idea. It would have been nice if they offered hotel transport but we took a cab anyway. The hotel was certainly splendid like any other Shangri-La should be, but it lacked the hospitality, sincerity and personal touch which I have experienced at other Shangri-La hotels. They don’t really value their guests here. I had to call room service 4 times (over a span of 2 days) before I could get two pairs of bathroom slippers and the mineral water that I asked for never came. This is absolutely unacceptable especially when the person on the other line tells you “we will get it for you straight away”. I also question what benefits a Golden Circle member could enjoy at the hotel as I could see none being a member myself. So why bother having such a membership programme in the first place? If I were to return to Vancouver, I’d probably stay at another hotel such as the Four Seasons where I would most likely get better service.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: C0nstantlyOnTheG0
Reviews.Content: After the rave reviews on Trip Advisor, we booked 4 rooms for the extended family, and were not disappointed.
