The hotel was sensational; very personal, which is often lacking in 5 star hotels; centrally located and within walking distance of all sites and shopping; located on West Georgia, probably the most central street in Vancouver; and located next to Urban Fare probably one of the best run deli/market stores we've seen anywhere in the world. The rooms were exceptional. Although we had a suite to accomodate 3 teenagers and 1 adult, we were very comfortably and luxuriously accommodated even to the point that a tv was located within the bathroom mirror. The kids loved that little inclusion. The beds were to die for and a pillow menu was available. The hotel gym located on the first floor was home to first class equipment and overlooked the streetscape of Vancouver with a heated pool in the vicinity. Wi-fi was free. Shangri-La gives true meaning to the 5 star experience. Service was superb at every level of the hotel and truly personifies an exceptionally managed hotel. Should we return to Vancouver we will definitely rebook.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Hotel in Vancouver, The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Simonsmiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a five star, that truly rates a five star. It's location is amazing, perfect for both business and leisure, great shopping and restaurants all around the hotel. The views are stunning and the rooms are fantastic. The staff are so wonderful and helpful, going out of their way to exceed all of my requests. I recommend this hotel to everyone, live like a King when your in Vancouver, and sleep like a baby. This is truly one of the most amazing hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and serene”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: First let me state that I did not stay at this hotel. I went there for lunch (review already posted) and was cheeky enough to ask if it was possible to see a room. I was shown 2 rooms, one standard, one executive, and the spa. (and no I did not tell them that I planned to write a review) Both rooms were spacious with top quality furnishings and linens. The style was understated elegance and every convenience was provided - even a walk-in closet in one room. The bathrooms were amazing - all marble with dual vessel sinks, large tub and powerful looking showers. Each of the rooms also had a balcony. The spa was tranquil with subdued lighting and the treatment room I saw was an oasis of calm with private shower and huge tub, fluffy robe and slippers. It was relaxing just to visit. The outside all year pool looked very inviting. The decor throuout the hotel was elegant and calm. lots of wood , a water wall, asian inspired hangings and a total feeling of quality. Naturally this quality is reflected in the price but one would expect that to be the case. The staff I spoke to were all extremely polite and helpful, especially the concierge who arranged for me to tour the rooms. The one slightly odd thing was that the main enterance is on the car park level - excellent privacy for the famous but hard to find when going for lunch. The street level eentrance brings you to the concierge desk where you will be courteously directed to your destination. I will deffinately consider this hotel for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel expereince in North America”
Reviews.Author: SafaAlak
Reviews.Content: I am frequent traveler in North America. I spent about 50% of my time in hotels. I am delighted by the quality of service at the Shangri-La at Vancouver. The room is excellent and the food was amazing. The price I paid for the hotel and food is so reasonable. This hotel will be my home in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “One Romantic New Years Eve at the Gorgeous Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: MortgageMike72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived in Vancouver all of our lives and when the opportunity came up to spend a night at the newly built Shangri-La Hotel for New Years Eve, we couldn't resist. We had heard so many wonderful things and were very excited. Our good friend Jeffrey Victor happens to be one f the concierges at the Hotel (although he was not working the night we stayed) and arranged to have a fabulous corner suite (the view rooms were all sold out by the time I booked) with a nice bottle of wine and fruit basket awaiting our arrival. It was one of those 550+/- SF units with a bar area and living room, and office with a flat screen TV (in both rooms) and even a TV in the bathroom MIRROR!!??!! The marble bathroom might have one questioning if there was any marble left in the world?! Flood to ceiling and heated floors! We didn't want to leave the room but I promised my wife some shopping on Robson before New Years dinner so off we went. When we came back, we just relaxed, watched some TV and enjoyed our bottle of wine until our late seating (9:30) at The Market restaurant down below. The restaurant was below our expectations due to the poor service. There were far too many people for such an intimate 6 course set-menu that we weren't eating our main until closer to midnight. However, the food was INCREDIBLE! My wife was not feeling like eating at that hour and was pretty full so we ended up taking our food back down to the room to eat the next day. All of our drinks were comped (all 6 of our 11.00 Martinis) for the inconvenience. It was hard to be angry as we didnt have far to go after dinner to get back to our room and the food was amazing after all. The next morning, I hit their state-of-the-art fitness facility for a workout (Damn, that was hard!) and enjoyed a delicious protein shake from their smoothie bar afterward. I went downstairs and next door to the Urban Fair market and grabbed us some delicious breakfast items to bring back to the room and called down for a late check-out (until 1PM). All in all, it was an incredible 24 hrs and we would not hesitate to stay again. It was an oasis in the city. I vacation in our own home town.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: subo-lover
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! great service and very luxurious, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Blankko
Reviews.Content: I had a pretty good start to my Vancouver Shangri-La experience as upon arrival I was informed that my room had been upgraded to a suite. The suite itself was all I could have expected. High quality fittings, large super modern bathroom and very comfortable in every respect. All the staff I came into contact with were very polite and helpful. In addition, the hotel was in a great location close to all the main sites and areas of interest. Would I stay here again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome until money was stolen.”
Reviews.Author: goldpanner99
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, right downtown, and the staff for the most part was fantastic. Service was great, we had a business reception, and then dinner at the restaurant, both went very well and were highly praised by attendees. Then we got back to our room and found almost $300 missing, from an envelope (birthday money my wife had received that day) and from my wallet in my pants i had changed out of for the reception. Management was concerned, but "this has never happened here before" is not even close to a sufficient response. After a 2 week "investigation" they decided it was indeterminate, whatever that means. Well, you know what? It's not undecided, you have a problem at your hotel. I guess you can still say it has never happened because nothing was proved, but honestly how many "investigations" does it take before you wake up? We know how much money was missing, you know (from the key reader) who went in the room, it's not rocket science here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, relatively quiet. I'll give it a "4".”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance to Stanley Pk., Yaletown, Gastown and the Skytrain, I couldn't have been happier with the location. The room and common areas were clean, not much of a view from the room though, and, with the exception of the cleaning crew going in and out of the adjacent unit, the hotel was quiet and I was able to sleep well in a comfortable bed. Wifi is included in the rate, so that's always good. Decorated in a transitional motif, I was pleased with the surroundings. The bath is clad in marble with a separate soaking tub, shower and flat screen. The room has the obligatory large flat screen, subwoofer and iPod dock, so you have what you need to work, relax and sleep. There's also a small refrigerator filled with beverages, but there's room to add a few things of your own in the event that you don't want to pay about $8 for an Evian. I'm not certain whether the hotel considers itself a four star or a five star property, but I'd say it's a solid four. From a service standpoint, I was slightly amused that no one offered to help with our luggage even though we were escorted us to our rooms. The gentleman guiding us to the rooms was full of conversation, but didn't take notice that we were a bit jet lagged and, under the circumstance, would have appreciated a little assistance with the bags. It wasn't the end of the world by any means, but if you're marketing a property in a certain manner, I guess I have certain expectations. Aside from a couple of other glitches (room was being cleaned when we returned around 4:30 PM (admittedly we left the room around Noon, so perhaps we're slightly at fault? and running out of some supplies), I'd consider another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Has taken a few steps backwards, not what it once was...”
Reviews.Author: WestwoodGlamGirl
Reviews.Content: Seems this Shangri-la has taken a few steps back toward mediocrity. Still same great service but room amenities have either disappeared of gone down hill. Towels are looking a little worse for wear, linens and bed are still very comfortable. They are now skimping on the l'occitane toiletries, no more dental kits. Laundry bags are now plastic when once cotton. Breakfast at Market is so-so and when considering the price; just over priced. Location is great, valet parking attendant on the money. Considering they are charging more than the 4 Seasons, Loden and L'Hermitage; you can get better bang for your buck elsewhere. By no means a bad hotel, just not worth over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: AC-Elite
Reviews.Content: I took a risk with this hotel - it wasn't the nominated conference hotel in Vancouver, but it had much better TripAdvisor reviews that the 'conference hotel'. And boy, did that risk pay off: the Shangri-La is a real haven of luxury and modernity, with everything carefully considered. The hotel is really well-located and has a fantastic supermarket with great fresh produce below - BC blackberries (the eating kind, not the crackberry kind) were a daily addiction. And for those less healthy moments, there's a Tim Horton's across the street. The rooms are amazing, with nifty little touches (tv screen located behind the bathroom mirror so you can watch the news while you're shaving). And when you close the curtains, the room is so dark (and perfect for sleeping) that you're in real sensory-deprivation territory. A real treat was the afternoon high tea service - the full traditional English style with some carefully-considered Asian inspirations. And the service was impeccable, flawless and warm. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Natsfan24
Reviews.Content: This might be the best hotel I have ever visited. The service from beginning to end was wonderful. Staff was quick to assist with any concern and to provide great ideas for what to do in Vancouver. The room was just perfect. Comfortable, with a great shower and bath, along with curtains you control from bedside. There was an Ipod deck next to the bed that played on the great sony flat screen in the room. It was a very quiet room and from the moment you walked in and saw a fresh fruit plate welcoming you, you knew it was a special place. The spa was beautiful and the pool area is outside and inviting. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: medicfx45
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler, and had a, Executive King (free Internet) that was facing the city side, and has a balcony. I was there Oct/Nov 2010 and rate was ~ $280 a night with ALL taxes included (possibly a bit less) - to get an idea of rates/costs. Excellent service from the underground check in. Has to be designed that way to avoid a traffic jam at street level. Very minimalistic environment, but very efficient. I was assisted with luggage and exiting the taxi, and they already knew my name! Spooky! They must have looked at my luggage tags? There are 2 check-in stations and check-in was smooth. The hotel is high tech. The room was big! Plenty of room to walk around, separate sitting area with couch, armchair and a huge TV (DVD). A big desk was also in the room and all lights are controlled by electronic dimmer switches. All drapes and sheers are also electronic/automatic. Internet (high speed) was free. There was always free bottled water delivered every day. There is a Nespresso capuccino/lungo machine in the room for free use, pods included. Plenty of item in the fridge, wines, etc, if you choose to use those. Plenty of teas are also available. Good enough size of a closet, with ironing board, free shoe shining service, umbrella in there for your use, just in case. Bathroom was big with a little TV incorporated in the mirror. Big shower, and separate tub. I believe no jacuzzi. Bathroom was all white marble, floor and walls. Looked awesome. Balcony was decent size, with table and 2 chairs. But it does face a busy street, but it's always good to have. Rooms service was great. They service twice a day. Between 6:30-930 they come to make your bed and prepare for the night. Cleaning crew addressed me by my last name. The lobby is again low key, it serves as the lobby for the condos as well, separate elevators, so you won't see extra personnel there. 1-2 people at the concierge. I never had to ask for much so I cannot report on how efficient they may be. Business center - only used it once, free internet, to print something. Pool - did not use - too cold... Food- only used in-room service twice - great service. Did not use bar/restaurant. Convention center: 10-15 minute walk. Easy. Overall: very happy with location and service. only reason I would stay elsewhere would be to be on the water with water views, but I would likely not give up the good service and the good, downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to mix business with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jmrmd
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a conference. Shangri-La was able to make my trip a true mix of business with pleasure. It is a 5 minute walk to the convention center thus making it very convenient. However what made my trip great was that after a day of relentless information, once I got inside the hotel, I felt relaxed and away from the madness of the day. The hotel is as I want hotels to be, nonobtrusive and private. Though it appears quiet, the staff is readily available, courteous and friendly. There is none of the "clubby scene" encountered with most other hotels. The bed and the pillows are the most comfortable I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A sophisticated, stylized hotel that doesn't scream "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: amanwarren
Reviews.Content: A great find and addition to the Vancouver hotel scene. The low-key nature of the hotel makes it even more inviting -- yet there is no sacrifice on the design, service and room quality. Also very conveniently located within walking distance to so much the city has to offer. Great recommendations from the Concierge staff. Great spa (a call out to the massage techniques of Gerald) and hotel gym. Would return in a heartbeat. Makes me want to check out other Shangri-La properties.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the hart of the city”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay in Shangri-La for two nights on my recent trip to Vancouver, however, due to the mishap with the reservation system we only spent one night in this property, but here are my observations: Room: Really nice, clean and spacious. Originally I was booked to a Superior room, but I was upgraded to the Deluxe room. When we entered the room we found a fruit bowl and some nice chocolate-chip cookies waiting for us along with the handwritten note from the hotel's General Manager welcoming us and wishing us a nice stay. I thought it was a very nice personal touch. Room itself was spacious, had a nice "office" area and I loved the nice, clean bathroom. The toiletries were good and beds were very comfortable. The only drawback was the fact that the coffee machine in our room did not work, however, we had a great selection of teas and that made up for it. Service: The front desk staff and the manager on duty were exceptional. As I mentioned earlier, there was an issue with the reservation, and basically the property did not have a room for us on the first night. The manager on duty handled it with the outmost class and kindness. I must say that I was really impressed by her people's skills. We were offered a room in another hotel along with the breakfast (which was included in our stay in Shangri-La) and transportation. When we returned to Shangri-La the next day, both valet and the front desk staff greeted us by our names and the manager herself checked us in and showed us to our room. One of the concierges was very nice and helpful. We were lost on our day of arrival, since we could not see the entrance into hotel (it is under ground), and the concierge came out with me to show me where to enter the garage. Another concierge was not nearly as nice and certainly had an attitude and very cool and standoffish demeanor. Not sure why he was acting like that, but it was so apparent, that even my sister, who does not speak a word of English, asked me after i spoke with the concierge if he was not very pleasant, or helpful. It was that apparent even from the body language and his facial expression. Location: Location of the hotel is superb, close to all major attractions and to the Vancouver Tram bus. Lots of great restaurants are within walking distance, lots of shopping is close by. Restaurant: We ate breakfast at the Market, and were not impressed at all. Service was very impersonal and extremely slow. As a matter of fact, several tables that were seated after us, were served before even though we did ordered the same food as everyone else. Considering that we had a child at our table, it would have been nice to get at least her order a bit sooner. Overall Impression: I picked Shangri-La over other comparable hotels because I had a great stay in Shangri-La Sydney. While Vancouver property is not quite on the same level as the Sydney one, I must say that I still truly liked this hotel and enjoyed my visit. I think the genuine kindness and professionalism of the hotel manager and the front desk staff certainly made up for any other shortcomings that we experienced. Room was great (see pictures) and location was excellent. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are considering a visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel for a Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: febryle
Reviews.Content: What a delightful and beautiful hotel! I concur with the vast majority of the 5 star reviews. Our stay at the Shangri-La Hotel was fantastic, with wonderful service from the concierge, registration desk, and bell staff. The room was fantastic with a great view and by far the best hotel lighting. The hotel's in a great location with convenient access to most of downtown Vancouver, including walking distance to Stanley Park. Our only complaint was the service at the hotel restaurant (Market), which was below par for any restaurant, let alone a high end one like this.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled8888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shangri La for three nights the beginning of September to celebrate my birthday. I selected the Shangri La based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked our room on Expedia and got a package for a superior room in which we stayed for three nights and paid for two nights. I made several inquiries to the Concierge desk before our arrival regarding airport arrival, transportation from the airport and restaurant suggestions. All the concierges were extremely helpful and professional and this continued thru out our stay. From the moment we arrived, every staff member without exception went above and beyond to make our stay extemely enjoyable. My husband and I seek out 5 star hotels and have travelled extensively worldwide. We have found that while amenities are important, the truly exceptional hotels have impeccable service. Our experience at the Shangri La did not disappoint. Other reviewers have commented extensively on the hotel amenties. While our room was just a superior room (I think this is the lowest category) and it was somewhat small, it was beautifully furnished and maintained. Although our room was on George Street, traffic noise was not an issue. Knowing that the hotel is not a water view hotel, we actually had a nice small view of a nearby boat harbor.The bathroom was of generous size and comfort and beautifully appointed. When we requested an additional sitting chair (the room had only one) It was brought almost immediately. A request for all decaf pods for the expresso machine, done. Thoughtful handwritten notes left by management and staff. Lovely. The hotel is beautifully decorated thru out, the spa in particular. The gift shop is quite small and should be expanded. They have a limited amount of Shanghai Tang items (too bad), but if you like the fragrance in the hotel, you can purchase it there. The location is ideal for walking to various sites. One day we took one of the free (tips appreciated) walking tours of Vancouver neighborhoods (Two guys Vancouver) Great! Very informative. The Urban Market next door is great for any food items you might like. We had dinner at Market one evening; the food was delicious, the service superb. The ambience of the restaurant is very soothing and refined, without being stuffy. It was a delight to return to this calm oasis each day. Thank you Shangri La staff for making my birthday so special!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more....”
Reviews.Author: avalon1025
Reviews.Content: I originally had planned to stay at this hotel in May, but my reservation was not able to be honored as the hotel was full. Fast forward to October and I finally was able to stay at the hotel. Overall, I wished I had stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. The room was nicely decorated and the beds comfortable, but my room was tiny for the price. More than one person and the room would have felt overcrowded. I left my roomat 9AM, returned around 2 to find my room had not been cleaned, when I enquired with guest services I was told they clean rooms through 4:00 (and what I would get turn down an hour later?). I was not able to use my room that afternoon as I did not want to be in the room with the maid. Cabs in Vancouver can never find the entrance and end up dropping you off at random spots around the hotel Overall, a nice quiet hotel, but not has 5 star as the reviews had lead to believe.

Reviews.Title: “You'll never want to leave your room..”
Reviews.Author: casmick
Reviews.Content: ..if it is as good as ours. From the moment we arrived, tired after the train from Jasper, we felt at home. The receptionist gave us some great advice about what to see in the city, gave us all the info on the room and led us to the lift. The room was spectacular, flat screen in main room and bathroom, a bath to swim in and soft fluffy gowns.Throughout our stay the staff could not do enough to help, the concierge told us the best way to everywhere, he knew everything about the city. The location is perfect accessible to all the city on foot. Overall an amazing stay which concluded a brilliant holiday in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “great location, convincing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: fritzrudolf
Reviews.Content: clean and light shangri la like rooms, looked welcoming even if the hotel wasnt recently renovated, the location close to the new convention center, the harbour and Stanley park is nice, very friendly and efficient staff (reception as well as concierge), totally convincing restaurant offering tasty light food

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's premier hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brianrg
Reviews.Content: Wow, I don't know where to start. From the moment you walk in to the time you check out the Shangri La is 10 out of 10. The staff are incredible. The Market Restaurant is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has a keen interest in getting your money and not doing too much for it”
Reviews.Author: duncan_kirk
Reviews.Content: To be fair to this hotel, it is clean, in a good location, and the rooms are of a good standard. Little deatures like the Nespresson coffee machine are good, but it is undone by there being no millk to make coffee. That was fairly typical of this hotel. Finding the entrance, if you are arriving by car, is a challenge as it is on a different street to the hotel's address. Once you're there, you check in in the basement. We arrived at 3pm and had to wait 45 minutes for our room, which was unacceptable. Room service was expensive and of a very average quality, but the room itself was pleasant. The bathroom was large and whilst there was an in-built TV in the bathroom mirror, it was tiny and you couldn't see it from the bath. Again, fairly typical of this hotel - a good idea poorly executed. We also had issues with the TV in the room in that we couldn't turn the TV off. Two hotel engineers later and after being told by both engineers and the concierge to try pressing the off button on the remote, they eventually figured out that the remote control in the room didn't match the TV! An hour or lost sleep later and it was finally resolved, but by then, we had a pair of sleep-deprived kids. Location is good - 2 blocks to the main shopping area. It's a long walk to Stanley Park though. Overall, not a great experience for a hotel charging these prices and we would seek to stay in one of Vancouver's many other 5 star hotels next time before staying in the Shangri-La again. There are bound to be one or two that would appreciate the custom, which this one certainly didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rod62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Quiet, serene, luxurious without being gawdy. The room is lovely, the breakfast and service devine, and the location is perfectly located in beautiful downtown Vancouver. Having the Urban Faire grocery store next door for munchies and treats was a bonus. We would definitely recomment this property.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with exceptional, unobtrusive service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: cswebb13
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Shangri-La for a relaxing getaway, and everything was fantastic. Service was excellent and professional but not obtrusive or 'snobby'. The public areas are scented, which was really nice as the scent was very pleasant. The hotel itself is the tallest building in Vancouver, and very architecturally striking. The lobby is classy, and check-in was efficient and professional. Our room was large, furnished asian-style decor, with dark woods, and soft lighting. The bathroom was a great size, not ridiculously huge, but comfortable; all marble, with a separate enclosure for the toilet, and a TV in the bathroom for news while getting ready or having a bath or shower. The bath products were from L'Occitane, and were a very nice touch. All the amenities were provided. The bed was insanely comfortable, very soft, and they offered a choice of pillows, and a nicely weighted duvet. There was also a 42" flat screen Sony TV and ipod dock, which was a nice touch. At night when we came back to the room, we found our room had been prepared for sleeping, and had a hand-written note and a plate of fresh fruit and bottled water provided for the evening. We spent the latter part of the evening at the outdoor pool and hot tub - and had the entire area to ourselves. The pool is quite small, so not suitable for many people and not a great destination for kids), but it had nice lighting and fountains, and the hot tub was nice. I noticed the pool area had a lot of tiling missing, and was dirty in some places around the pool edges. Cabanas were also provided for daytime relaxing. Being in a hot tub on the rooftop in downtown Vancouver is a nice way to spend an evening. Our hotel stay included a $76 ($38/person) breakfast credit in the hotel's restaurant (Market by Jean-Georges). Breakfast was exquisite. I'd heard many great reviews of the French toast, and it did not disappoint! perfectly cooked. My girlfriend had eggs benedict and granola with yogurt, both presented and prepared perfectly. Fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice not to be missed! Service in the restaurant was exceptional, as was the decor and atmosphere. We were pleased with the entire experience at the Shangri-La - from the moment the building takes your breath away, to the exceptional and unpretentious service, comfortable and well appointed room, and fantastic breakfast. All around, a highly recommended experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and the rooms aren't that special”
Reviews.Author: scfphoto
Reviews.Content: Located on the busiest street in the city with very poor construction, this is a noisy hotel and not the sanctuary you crave. Rooms are obviously newly done but they lack real style and even an executive suite is quite small. Linens and spa are exquisite. Staff is helpful. We tried moving rooms but it was still difficult to sleep, even with ear plugs. We changed to the Loden on our way back thru Vancouver and truly liked the rooms; it was significantly quieter and had a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and luxury to the nth degree”
Reviews.Author: cohenprof
Reviews.Content: The concierge service at this hotel is the finest I have ever encountered!!! I emailed and spoke with Sureena on several occasions prior to the trip. She was extremely helpful and professional. It was such a pleasure to work with her. She arranged for a car/driver to pick up my parents from the train station and to take them on a guided tour of the city. She took care to address my questions about the Vancourver Art Gallery and various restaurants etc. Every detail requested was taken care of including what I wanted supplied in the hotel room, and ensuring that Tammy was available to carefully explain all the details of the room -- everything is automated -- lights, curtains etc. My parents had never seen such luxury -- the bathroom is the same size of a usual hotel room. The services in the hotel and the restaurants are superb. As my father had difficulty walking to the restaurant, Richard, the restaurant manager, and Virginia and David, helped to provide assistance and ensured my parents had a special evening. This is a place where they take care to serve your every need. This is amazing hospitality. The hotel is well located and is sumptious in its design. If you want to have a special experience and pamper yourself -- this is the place to be. They have a fabulous spa in this hotel -- perfect for a romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Because this hotel is totally awesome, you will have trouble checking out”
Reviews.Author: user980401
Reviews.Content: My room was so delightful, that I didn't want to leave it. The room was immaculate, very clean. The bathroom was my favorite, with a huge soaking tub, see thru shower, and a tv in the mirror. Everything in the bathroom felt and looked like white marble from the border around the tub to the tile on the floor. The bed was unbelievable, so comfortable that it made the Hilton and Marriott hotel bed feel like a Motel 6 bed. In general, the whole room was elegant with wood that looked like mahogany. As a single woman, I felt very secure because you have to have a room card to activate the elevator, your room control, and other facilities throughout the hotel. I loved the technology, just push a button and the drapes would open, lights dim to reading, evening, or night, even "do not disturb" under your room number lights up at the push of a button. At most hotels, you can hear everyone in the next room. I didn't hear anyone in the neighboring rooms. Very quiet and nice large room, equal in size to any hotel suite room. This hotel was awesome, and I would suggest it to anybody that wanted to stay in a nice hotel while visiting Vancouver. It's in a excellent location in downtown Vancouver. It's close to the pier for cruise ships visitors, like myself, Robson St., Stanley Park, Amtrak, and restaurants galore. I paid a little over $300 a night on Expedia and got an awesome room at the Shangri-La with an incredible view and breakfast. The service at breakfast was excellent. They had fresh squeezed orange juice! I had the pancakes with real Canadian maple syrup, bacon, and fresh fruit. My favorite special touch was that in my room each day was a complimentary bottle of Whistler water, and a fresh fruit plate (banana, apple, and plum) that had a very special note, with my name hand written on it, that welcomed me to my room, and the Shangri-La. I've stayed at a lot of hotels including the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando, and Royal Hawaiian in Honolulu, and this hotel was more awesome than any hotel that I've ever been blessed to encounter. My only regret is that I couldn't stay longer at the Shangri-La, I even begged for a late check out time, but it wasn't available because another guest was waiting on my room. The business center was even elelgant with big screen Sony computer, with free internet, and 5 print pages. The lady that helped me in the business center was great, and very nice. Even the people that greeted me at the door, and parked my car, bent over backwards to help me find locations in Vancouver. There were people needing to get by me in the parking garage, and the doormen stayed calm, and nicely gave me directions to the Amtrak, and post office. One of the doormen, even programmed my GPS! I guarantee that if you stay at the Shangri-La hotel, you will be pleasantly pleased and impressed with this hotel, and customer service. Every staff member seemed very concern about me having a good time and constantly asked me if I needed anything to enhance my visit. Shangri-La thanks for a wonderful visit in downtown Vancouver. Currently, I'm still dreaming about that huge soaking tub, tv in the mirror, and pancakes with maple syrup! I wish that room 1506 would have fitted into one of my bags. I would have loved to have taken a piece of the Shangri-La home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella50
Reviews.Content: During a recent Alaskan Cruise due to mechanical difficulties we were unable to visit Vancouver. So we decided to go on our own. After researching hotels we decided on the Shangri-La. Thank goodness we did!! What exceptional service. Jarren the concierge never and I mean never steared us wrong!! We enjoyed every minute of the 3 days we had, we had great food, drink and hit all the great spots. If he didn't take the time each day to help us out and point us in the right direction it may not have been so rewarding. He went above and beyond. The hotel is just glorious, amenities are superior and the spa also is top notch. If you have the opportunity go, don't pass this one up!!

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: RandolphJames
Reviews.Content: This is the highest level of service I have ever experienced in a hotel. I have stayed at many 4-5 star places (including the other nice hotel "L" nearby) and I must say this was so far the best. There was something about the way the people who worked there had a genuine appreciation for you being there. Unlike many "expensive" hotels that can be snobby, these people treat you with respect and genuine kindness. When we arrived in their car reception area they were so nice and professional on how they handled everything. We were driving our hybrid and most of the cars there were very expensive including a Lambo parked up front. Again they treated us with the highest level of service regardless of what we were driving (you all know what I mean). The Girl at the front desk was extremely personal and professional and had told us that the hotel had "complimentary upgraded" us to the next level of room . Wow, were were surprised when we heard that. We had chosen the "Autumn" package which includes free parking and a breakfast each morning at their incredible restaurant MARKET by Jean-Georges. When we arrived at out room, it was so incredible; everything so clean we couldn't believe it!!! There was a personal "hand written" note from the general manager "Mr Brea" thanking us for choosing their hotel and wishing us a great stay. Where did they find this person? Its like out of a movie to see this kind of service from ANY hotel these days. The room was huge and well designed and included 2 balconies to see outside. The quality of the finishes, the lack of dust anywhere was awesome. The bed is one of the best I have ever slept on in a hotel and I wanted to take in home in my suitcase ( and we sleep on a dux!!):) The entire place must be appreciated by those wanting an experience that's unpretentious and yet of the highest class. We will be back. Randy

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in My Life”
Reviews.Author: mBahareth
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La Hotel is nothing but an overrated Hotel and over Priced. i payed over 500 $ per night and i did not get a big room nor did i get the service from a well known 5 star Hotel , it's a descries for a city such as Vancouver to have a Racist Hotel. We Got Profiled Because of our Ethnic Background and treated so badly , there is no porter to help you with your shopping bags , No Security Personel What so Ever in the Hotel , No one at The Door , Concierge is a 1 person stand , Calls dont get answered till 6-7 min waiting . i have travled the world , been to Japan , New Zealand , Australia , USA , UK , Germany , France and all over but i have never seen such a treatment , and racial profiling such as i have seen in this hotel , we are guests of canada guest of the hotel and we should all be treated equally or not at all .

Reviews.Title: “Will go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: trhay
Reviews.Content: Awesome room, central location, fantastic concierge staff, professional and efficient front desk and bell staff. All together enjoyable. Staff took lots of time with us... on everything from making restaurant reservations to making arrangements to park our oversized car (based on 2 seventeen -foot kayaks on top).

Reviews.Title: “Very good, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Kanuckian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a choice for one night before our return to Toronto from being at Sonora Resort for 3 nights. I chose it because of reviews on TripAdvisor. When we arrived we asked for an upgrade from an executive suite to a 1-bedroom - we were given this for $40 extra. The room was really nice and had some very cool modern features such as a TV built right into the mirror in the bathroom. The only thing that I would complain about was the couch size in the suite area of the 1-bedroom - it is not made for a man or women taller than 5'6" - it is short and uncomfortable. The restaurant has the signature of a Michelin 3 star chef - Jean-Georges, but the food and service were VERY average. The restaurant was very noise and out on the heated terrace (which is a nice touch) the dance/techno music was pounding - we switched tables. All in all, for one night it was comfortable and the amenities were what you would expect for $400/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but...”
Reviews.Author: toyBeirut
Reviews.Content: No complaints here but one... no room service after 11PM!! They just offer a very brief menu passed this time... We called at 11:05, and there was no way we could get a plate of spaghetti! Come on! This is a shagri-la!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its name "Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: LondonTLeaves
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, fantastic genuinely friendly and helpful staff, great location. We got the breakfast deal, it is not buffet, but the food was excellent. Gorgeous rooms, with great mattresses. Our only complaint was that we stayed 7 nights and asked for quiet room but were put near the lifts. However the doors are quite thick so it was relatively quiet, however l would have appreciated them putting us in a quieter room considering the length of stay. Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “No ocean view, but fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: globetripper78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for 4 nights with our labradour retriever. Both we and our dog were warmly welcomed - in our room was a beautiful dog bed an bowl awaiting our canine family member. I was hesitant to bring him to such a sophisticated place, but I was delightfully surprised with his treatment. The rooms are incredibly modern and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. So much so, that I contacted management to find out how I could get one for myself. It's a foam top, in case you were wondering. Electronic black out blinds make the room a heavenly cove. Look into expedia.ca where we got a deal that included valet parking and breakfast (a real breakfast!). French toast is delicious breakfast-cake. Food at Jean Georges is FABULOUS. Outdoor patio has no view at all. All-in-all, a wonderful stay. Well worth it's price. To compare, we stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle with an ocean view, and felt cheated because we weren't at the Shangri La!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in August and first, the good things. The, location, in downtown is very good and close to Robson Street and not far from many places to visit in Vancouver. There is a Supermarket next door (Urban Fare) that is a good place to buy things or have an inexpensive meal. Second, the hotel is quite new, so most of the fittings are good and especially the Nespresso coffee machine in the room. Third, service mind is very good except in Market restaurant as it will depends on who is your server. Then, the not so good things. If you get a suite room, (as we were upgraded) then the A/C may not cool your bedroom properly, so it could be quite warm at the beginning of the night, so it will be better to stay in small room, so the temperature will be more consistent. I also must say that if you have balcony it may come with a poor view (as the hotel is in the lower floors of the building is not worth it to get a balcony). The servicing of the room was never done in the morning, but in the afternoon both days we stay there. Even they claim that they were doing turndown service in the evening this was not true, except the first and they just service the room once a day the second and third day. Then, the breakfast at Market restaurant was not good as already mentioned by other people as first, service was very slow. One day we have to wait for table 10 minutes and then 10 more minutes to ask for our order, then when requested the American breakfast (they called the Deluxe breakfast, quite a joke !!!), 2 eggs any style does not let you have an omelette and they said we have to pay 4 C$ extra. When we complain they said they will not charge us, but this was clearly very low class from such property that claims to offer excellent service. Besides that the staff was rude when we complain about the omelette surcharge and later on ther rest of the service was very bad and even though they waive the charges of that breakfast we decided not to come back the following day, even though they told us they will waive again. The TV selection is very poor, not a decent movie channel as they just offer movies on sale (very bad again) and not even a music channel. I can even get better TV sleection in a Comfort Inn or Best Western Inn. Having stayed in many other Shangri-la properties before, this experience was by far the most disappointing and it seems that the excellent standards they have in Asia cannot be kept in their property in Vancouver, so at the end of the day is not worth it to pay their room rates to get such lousy service when having your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Shangri-La with a Vancouver twist”
Reviews.Author: rtybc
Reviews.Content: Unlike the sprawling common spaces you expect to see in an Asian hotel the shangri la Vancouver is simple minimalistic but with all the right elements to say. Welcome to the shangri la. From e greeting of the doorman to the waiters at the restaurant. As usual a wonderful experience. Don't miss the chi spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but definitely not up to Shangri-La standards”
Reviews.Author: Matt584099
Reviews.Content: Arrived last night for the start of a 6 day stay in Vancouver. I was really looking forward to staying at the Shangri-La as my experiences in their hotels elsewhere were excellent. However it is a disappointment and just doesnt have the ambiance of what you would expect of a hotel of this supposed class, The primarily disappointment was the room. I booked an Executive King with Balcony, expecting as detailed in their website to be above to step outside and enjoy the city. Sadly this is definitely one for the trade descriptions act, as you quickly find out when you wonder on down to the reception to check if you have been given the wrong room, that this is an enclosed balcony (strangely not detailed as such in their website). By enclosed balancy they mean a part of the room which is partitioned by sliding doors and has a small opening in the window. Definitely a feature not to waste your money on. The rest of the room is great and the staff friendly and helpful (except when its comes to balconies). Several reviews on commented on the reception and lobby being a little strange. This is a fair assessment as neither have the wow factor you normally expect to experience. All in all, a okay hotel but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: puretorico
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la Hotel in Vancouver is simply the best hotel in the city. This was our 2nd time to stay at the Shangri-La while vacationing in and around Vancouver. Each experience at the hotel has been a delight - the rooms are spacious and designed to give maximum comfort and a real sense of serenity. The staff take genuine pleasure in providing the highest level of service. We stayed for 4 nights and look forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: norwaytravler
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful hotel you could imagine!! From the chek in- to the LARGE room ameneties- to the breakfast! All is just WOW. The best yet! I forgott my postcards (7-8 )in my room- and rememberd it a day later, and they cindly posted them for me- without a fee. What other hotel do that??? For what you get - this hotel is NOT expencive! Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Would go there every night if I could!”
Reviews.Author: Fischbowl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. What struck me the most was the staff. Usually at such a high end hotel the staff can be snobish or cold at times. Every single person we ran into was super friendly and genuine. The rooms were beautiful. The lighting and controls made the room ambiance very warm. The food was exceptional. The french toast is so good it is beyond description. The rooms were so quite one would never know you were actually in the middle of down town.

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of Canada's Premiere Hotel Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Review1031
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 5 days in Vancouver and decided to treat ourselves to a 5 star experience! MY husband found the Shangri-La on line and decided it looked like a beauitiful place with wonderful amenities and in a location that was perfect to get to shopping, the water front and of course, Vancouver's pearl....Stanley Park! From our first steps in the door, all the staff were amazingly kind and efficient in getting us settled into our room. The restaurant food was "incredible"...wow! We liked the food and staff so much at lunch our first day, we decided to eat there again two more times. It was amazing, the staff were again were really friendly and efficient, made the whole experience a fantastic one! Finally, my husband treated me to the Spa, wow!! To say I enjoyed it would be an understatement! I LOVED it!! The ambience in the Spa is exotic and relaxing with the soft earth tones that just make one melt into the furniture! There is an aire of splendour in this space, it would be difficult not to enjoy your time there. The treatment itself was fabulous, the care giver was very good, knew the art of her treatment very well. I was thrilled by the whole experience. If I lived in Vancouver,I would be there every week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, terrific staff, excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 8travelbug
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel. My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Shangri-La, visiting Vancouver with friends. We had a wonderful room overlooking Georgia Street. It was spacious, comfortable and well-appointed. Wonderful bedding, "smart" electronics. The bathroom was elegant and functional at the same time, white marble with very smart features to ensure comfort and utility. Staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to be helpful. We had one dinner at the restaurant - very good, although service seemed very slow. We loved being on the terrace, enjoying the fresh air. We did not use the spa or exercise facilities, but we looked at them at thought they looked wonderful. My only negative comment is that I thought the room lighting was inadequate. We had a small couch, but poor lighting made it impossible to use it for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: LondonWestEnd
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel. I have stayed numerous times in Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton hotels all over the world, but this hotel still managed to leave an impression. I was upgraded to a suite, which was simply beautiful, with a large balcony. My recommendation is not to book the cheapest room, but to book a balcony room. As these rooms are in short supply, you will be the top of the list for an upgrade to a magnificent suite. The hotel feels more like a private residence than a hotel; but I mean this in a positive way. And I also liked the two-level lobby, with cars on the lower level; which keeps the traffic out of the lobby. Location is also very good. The only downside, perhaps, is that all the hotel rooms are on the lower levels, so you will not have a nice view (the upper floors are private residences). This is without a doubt the best hotel in Vancouver, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, World-Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdp077
Reviews.Content: An top-tier hotel. Beautiful rooms, excellent facilities and amenities, attentive staff, excellent restaurant, great downtown location. There is nothing you could want that this hotel does not have.

Reviews.Title: “Extream friendly, confortable, convenient, professional- wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Macayla
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Shangri-la Vancouver in June. We had a wonderful experience there. From the concierge to front desk, to the staff at the Market. Service: we met people who are very willing to take their time and effort to help us. Actually, they started to give us help regarding our travel plans,even before we travelling into the country, as this was the first time for us in Vancouver. They advised on our trip to another destination, arranged real estate agent for us. Without them, our trip would not have been so wonderful. Whenever we needed, they were always there to assist. They handled things very professionally, very warm, and in the mean time, kept a very confortable distant to avoid being too pushy or too casual. Food:Market is the inhouse dinning place. Great food, great service, great enviroment. Breakfast is great too. Location: The hotel is also very conveniently located, very close to the restaurants and shops. The Japaness restaurant accoss the street is very nice. Value:When you consider breakfast is included in the price, it is not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but can improve”
Reviews.Author: octraveler08
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for four nights to attend a family reunion recently and overall, we were comfortable and pleased with the hotel. As a pleasant surprise, the hotel upgraded our room upon our arrival. The room was generously sized and very comfortable. Everything was in good working order (remote control of drapes, heating/cooling, etc.) The toiletries were top quality, and our rooms were serviced adequately, though some days, a more thorough job would have been appreciated. All service people were friendly and courteous when we came upon them in the hallways, etc. A big disappointment was in the "pool." Before we arrived, I wondered why there was no picture of the pool on their Web site, and when I arrived, I understood. It's miniscule--more like a wading pool. For some of us who swim for exercise, this was a let down. Food in the hotel restaurant was good at breakfast, though we found dinner to be overpriced and a little over seasoned, but that's just our taste. Location is very convenient to shopping of all kinds, and right next door is a food store that has gourmet products as well as everyday necessities. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but felt it to be lower in quality to the better Four Seasons. I will say, though, that their free wi-fi beats Four Seasons where you have to pay. In this day and age, I don't think there's any excuse for an expensive hotel to not offer free wifi to guests, so on this aspect, they have FS beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: jiffypop101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. We stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The service is as good as it can be and the rooms are top notch. World class. A bit on the expensive side but you have to try this place. The restaurant serves the best breakfast I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SLI22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to stay hotels that are part of the American Express fine hotels of the world. The Shangri-La lived up to its reputation as a fine hotel and more. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite that was full of all the bells and whistles one could desire. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. The bed was the best we have ever slept in. Also, the location, right in the heart of downtown, is perfect. The concierge and the other staff were attentive and extremely helpful with any questions we had. In addition, we ate at the Market, the hotel restaurant, every morning and one evening and found the food delicious. I would never stay any place else but this hotel if I ever return to Vancouver. It's expensive, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reviews misleading”
Reviews.Author: sherlock1954
Reviews.Content: This is the very first time I find the Tripadvisor reviews misleading. This hotel is expensive and I was expecting a very high quality. The rooms are small and the corridors dark, the hotel does not go above the 15th floor, don't expect a view except of office buildings. The pool was tiny and occupied by noisy children. We tried the restaurant and although it has a fancy chef you don't have much choice on what you eat, as most menus are prix fixe. At the end of the stay, although I had checked when we checked in that our rate was 3 nights for the price of 2, they tried to charge us for the full price of 3 nights anyway, all in all very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional quality and service; can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: pinkcoatb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this glorious hotel twice now and cannot wait until my next trip to Vancouver to stay again. From check-in to check-out, and every step along the way, the hotel and its staff exceeded my expectations. The underground check-in was extremely efficient; I appreciated that the staff knew this was my second visit and welcomed me back to the hotel. The concierge provided useful recommendations for hotels, bars, and bike rentals, and every staff member I encountered was genuinely friendly and always helpful. The bed and bedding were comfortable and other in-room amenities (bathrobe, slippers, umbrella, coffee maker, etc) were high quality. Love the L'Occitane products and heated floors in the bathroom. Check out was a breeze, and the boarding pass print station was handy. I had breakfast at Market as part of my package, and every waiter and hostess I encountered during my six day stay were friendly and appropriately chatty. The food was delicious, although I likely would have not eaten there without the package as it is quite pricey breakfast. The grocery store next to the hotel has great snacks as well. The hotel is about a five-minute walk away from the new Vancouver Conference Center. I used the gym everyday: good equipment, clean locker rooms. The steam room is average--I would have preferred some sort of eucalyptus smell or something, but on the whole, it was fine. Despite the chilly weather, I managed to swim twice because the pool is heated. The spa experience (body scrub + scalp massage + foot massage) was among the finest in the life. The booking process was simple, and the technician was superior at her craft and seemed like a very nice, sweet person. I was able to find much cheaper prices on Expedia than on the hotel's own website, so be sure to check out sites like that when looking for the best rate. I am very impressed with the Shangri-La brand as a whole. I am currently planning my honeymoon to Asia, and we will certainly be staying at Shangri-La hotels as frequently as we can.

Reviews.Title: “I just doesn't get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: prs54fmpu
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Shangri-La that has not already been said, it is truly a unique experience from the mood lighting in the bedroom to the fabulous staff, I have travelled extensively and stayed in some of the best hotels in the world, but this was my first experience of a Shangri-La, from the moment you arrive you feel important and welcome, the reception is quaint and the staff excellent the concierge brilliant. The room staggering, I have never seen as many buttons to alter the lighting. The bathroom was wonderful and filled with L’Occitane products, yes you are in the city and privacy could be problem, but you have automatic blinds so who cares. A separate bath and shower are provided and two sinks so travelling with a partner makes getting ready a simple affair, a separate dressing room for all your cases keeps the main bedroom neat and tidy. So are there any issues, well yes, it is noisy, we stayed on the ninth floor and could not believe that an inner city hotel had such poor sound proofing, our room was on the corner of Thurlow and Alberni, it was so bad we could get to sleep until 4 in the morning, we did mention this at check out and got a very negative response as though it was impossible that anything could be wrong with the hotel. Due to the attitude you start to find other problems, the plug did not work in the second sink, the TV did not come on with sound sometimes, a lamp did not work properly, and would this stop be going back absolutely not, I would just get a better room. P.S. The lounge bar staff fantastic, and now they can also make a proper Pimms

Reviews.Title: “the nicest room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: peggyharp
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the world and have stayed in every kind of accomodation possible and this was one of the nicest rooms I have ever been in (definately outclasses the much overranked Oriental in Bangkok). The Shangri-La Hotel in Vancouver was amazing. From check-in-quick, private and friendly, to the gourmet breakfast (included!) eveything was top notch. It was a treat to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to treat yourself and endulge, Shangri La is perfect”
Reviews.Author: beamen01
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are excellent and the location is great if you are looking to stay in downtown Vancouver. An excellent overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vancouver for luxury and service, but lacks any views”
Reviews.Author: simondo84
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la is by far and away the best hotel in Vancouver in terms of luxury, by a significant margin. This is very much matched by the service, although it is a more formal type of service which will be familiar to anyone who is used to travelling in Asia. Rooms: We stayed in a standard guest room with a beautiful King bed. The sheets had an exceptionally high thread count, and the bed was the perfect level of firmness. The electronic lighting controllers created a beautiful ambience at any time of day at the push of a button. The hotel has a distinctly asian themed decor, carried in to each rooms with the fabric wall paper, beautiful dark wood furniture and some nice asian art. Each room is adorned with a fantastic Sony TV (50"), surround sound, iPod dock and free wi-fi. Bathrooms: Excellent. Marble from top to bottom, fluffy luxurious towels and robes, walk in shower, bathtub, TV in the bathroom mirror and L'Occitane toiletries. Restaurant: Marketplace is a beautiful modern fine dining experience. Expect nothing but the best in terms of food, wine and service. Many of the dishes have an Asian twist, but the cuisine is more European in my opinion. Pool and Spa: Whilst the spa looked great, I did not have a treatment. The pool was OK, but looks out on a very unattractive car park. The hot tub is the same. The fitness suite is as you would expect. Car Parking: Full valet service is excellent Service: Nothing is too much to ask, they really have brought the service found in Asian hotels right in to North America. Staff are friendly, gracious and impeccably dressed. Don't be intimidated by the formality of it, its really they type of service they are striving for. Whilst it may on the surface seem less warm and friendly, I guarantee they will never let your water glass go empty, your pillow unfluffed, your presence not greeted. Brilliant! Location: Great for business travellers, but for leisure I think staying on Waterfront is better. The Shangri-la hotel occupies the LOWEST 15 floors of the tallest building in Vancouver, so there is nothing to see in any direction, just offices and some ugly car parking garage. So if you are visiting, I would go for the Fairmont Pacifc Rim or Pan Pacific and you can wake up every morning to views over the Burrard Inlet and the mountains... that is if you can cope without staying right in the lap of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaulke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Love the non-traditional layout without a formal lobby. The service was very attentive. The breakfast was very good. The location is superb - right in the middle of everything. I would have given it 5 stars if not for the fact the we were charged extra $75 upon checkout even though the rate was fully prepaid. Not a bid deal but still...

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING hotel & impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: millions1
Reviews.Content: Want to feel like a VIP - stay at the luxurious "Shangri-La Hotel". The ammenities and service is outstanding, you will never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: squdgee
Reviews.Content: The suite room was large, clean and luxurious. The entire staff was kind, courtious and helpful. I felt like a truely valued customer. Concierge staff was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service!”
Reviews.Author: BC-KVB
Reviews.Content: First stay at a Shangri-La, definitely will not be my last if it is up to me! An oasis of placid serenity, even though it's located right on West Georgia, Fabulous, very attentive staff. Wonderful place to stay! Now stay away from my hotel! Lol

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: Petarjake
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel...beautifully appointed with the service and staff friendliness to match. The concierge was always very helpful and listened before making their recommendations for dinner in different parts of town. The location was perfect and walking distance or a short cab to wherever we wanted to go. My only slightly negative comment was not allowing any outside food or drink in the pool area. Other than that, it was a very impressive hotel and a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “good but not exceptional 5*”
Reviews.Author: fussyboss
Reviews.Content: Had two executive rooms for 3 nights in March. As described by other reviewers, beautifully appointed new hotel, lovely rooms with all modern gizmos, tip-top bed and large luxury bathroom, superb attention to detail throughout. However, the rooms are in full view of a busy office block and for privacy the drapes need to remain drawn! Service very good but not perfect. Restaurant good but not great, if we hadn't had a package would not have bothered with breakfast a second time, wouldn't make a special trip for dinner, divan seating uncomfortably close to other diners. Excellent gym. Basically, this is what I expect of a stylish, good 5 star hotel but it is is not in my opinion exceptional and we'll be back to one of the Fairmont's next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stay at! Should be 6 stars!”
Reviews.Author: turf727
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beyond 5 stars. It puts other 5 star hotels to shame. It is a beautiful place, where tremendous thought has been but into every design. Everything is of the highest quality and highest level of design and function. The fabrics and textiles are amazing. The all marble bath was beyond beautiful, elegant, and very confortable (seperate tub/shower/toilet area). The bathroom was indeed my dream bathroom. The service, of course, was top quality too. The people are friendly, professional, and focused on the highest level of quality service. I wish there were Sangri La hotels throughout the USA (where I live), but sadly no. Hopefully they will expand. My stay couldn’t have been more elegant or lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable As Always”
Reviews.Author: colinchau
Reviews.Content: We dined at the restaurant at Shangri-La Vancouver - Market by Jean-Georges. We had a great time and as always the service was great. The food was cooked perfectly and the plating was excellent. It was the first, second, and third time for the three of us there, and all of us would definitely love to come back any time. The staff were very helpful and kind in being responsive to a request to have the recipe for two of their dishes, the Arctic Char and Red Snapper. As promised, the Executive Chef was referred to our request and he kindly sent the recipes to us directly by email. Never once have we gotten push back or attitude from the staff, and they're always happy to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Vancouver is a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: RhiannonBrisbane
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step foot inside this emaculate hotel you feel right at home. The staff are most helpful, the atmosphere is relaxing, the food is great and the facilities cater to almost every need! And if you are passionate about good beds, this hotel takes first prize for comfort. The softest, fluffiest most luxurious sheets, pillows and duvets will keep you sleeping for days!

Reviews.Title: “My first 5 star review!”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here on the way home from a relaxing trip up to Whistler. Finding the entrance to this hotel can be a bit tricky. It is in the garage on the lower level. We had to circle around the block. It is very easy to drive right by this building and not even realize it is a hotel. Check in went pretty smoothly. Within minutes we were on our way to the room. This room has to be one of the most spacious and beautifully appointed hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. I would describe the room as modern Asian minimalism. The bathroom was so gorgeous I didn't want to leave. My main criteria for judging a room is the bed and the water pressure on the shower and both were phenominal. Upon checkin there was a small fruit plate along with a handwritten note from the manager what a classy touch! The staff are very low key yet extremely friendly. Turndown in the evening was great instead of the expected choclates was a bookmark with quotes from the book lost horizon. I could just go on and on with all of the small attention to details of this place. The hotel is in a great location just a block away from Robson street the main shopping district of downtown Vancouver. This hotel will definitely be my hotel of choice for Vancouver from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMichelle
Reviews.Content: My husvband and I stayed at the Shangri La and would confidently say it was one of the best three hotels we have ever stayed at. From the moment we checked in the service was exceptional to say the least. The Concierge was without doubt the best we've ever experienced, recommending restaurants and making reservations for us - nothing was a bother. The decor is stunningly modern but still welcoming and tranquil. The Lobby Bar and Restaurant on 3rd floor, were extremely good. Free internet access in the Business Centre, and a location one block from Robson Street (and fantastic restaurants) are an added bonus. All in all, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a sophisicated and charming hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Expected”
Reviews.Author: World Passport
Reviews.Content: Sure I've heard about this chain hotel before but the service is not as expected. Very small hotel parking entrance and the view from your room is absolutely NONE. For over US$300 a night, you would expect to have at least a decent view other than facing directly to an office building where people can look at you during their working hours. Privacy is NONE unless you want to close the curtain all day long. Breakfast is average. Cannot trust everybody's reviews on Trip Advisor anymore. Seating arrangement in the breakfast room is super bad. They seat you so close to each other. Ridiculous for a 5 star hotel. The AC in the room is rather noisy. I have to use an ear plug for my entire stay. You can hear the street noise from the street below even from the 11th floor. Will not be going back to this hotel anymore. Plenty of other hotels in the same area such as the Hyatt, Westin Grand, Four Seasons, Fairmont, etc. If view, breakfast, location, and service are important for you, then this is definitely not a hotel for you. I cannot believe that this is no. 1 Vancouver hotel in Trip Advisor. Why??? just because it's new???

Reviews.Title: “Asian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTommy
Reviews.Content: This hotel manages to combine sophistication, hospitality and intimacy. Great asian hospitality influences. Loved the checkin, by the time I walked to the desk my paperwork was waiting. Location was good very close to Robson St. Exciting rooms and bathrooms with automated curtains and lights and more. Beautiful finishes. Great desk for laptop. I was here for only one night wished I could stay more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Kenny_Blankenship
Reviews.Content: While celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, my wife and I spent one night at the Vancouver Shangri-La following a cruise. The staff was extraordinary, the property is modern, spotless and comfortable and is perfectly situated in the city. We were even unexpectedly surprised with a lovely anniversary cake delivered to our room. The Shangri-La provided a perfect ending to a special trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great location!”
Reviews.Author: housy123
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel and is in an excellent location. Beautifully appointed and very nice staff. The concierge(s) were EXCELLENT and extremely helpful. The first time I ahve ever used a service that was really that good! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: tigger000
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with great service. Location perfect for exploring Vancouver, close to shops, restaurants. Inclusive breakfast was amazing, although if it hadn't been included in the room rate it would have been expensive. Room upgraded without asking, very high quality rooms. Definitely recommend this hotel if you can get it a discounted rate or you're looking for something special.

Reviews.Title: “A True 5-Star Hotel! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: sctrojan1
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this hotel ranks high in Tripadvisor. The hotel was awesome. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The beds were comfortable. Of course the service was excellent as well, including the front desk, valets, and housekeeping. We stayed here for 5 days and we felt welcomed by the staff during our entire stay. We ate breakfast at Market (in the hotel) every day and the breakfast was awesome and so was the service. The location is convenient since it is just a block to the shops on Robson Street. There is an Urban Fare Market right next to the hotel that has groceries. I highly recommend this hotel. TIP: The entrance to the underground parking is on Alberni St.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the middle of a world class city”
Reviews.Author: rick_obrien
Reviews.Content: The room was stunning with beautifully finished amenities and little extra's like bowls of fresh fruit, a personalized welcoming note and even a mini TV screen built into the bathroom mirror. And, never taken for granted, it was so quiet...what wonderful sleeps we had. For us, however, the highlight was "Market ", Shangri-La's contribution to exquisite dining. Our meal was an experience...an adventurous menu and wine list to match; service that is polished and friendly and all of it within a room that is always busy but never too loud, just right and fun. For us, the occasion was my wife's special birthday...and we will never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Shangri-La Hotel was the ultimate experience in every way.”
Reviews.Author: travelinfoolFlorida
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 3 days and were treated royally from the time we arrived until the time we checked out. The staff at reception was extraordinary. They were helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable. The concierge was happy to print out our boarding passes and was gracious even though it was a long, tedious procedure. The room was spectacular....a large sitting area, comfortable beds, and a bathroom that was beyond luxurious. The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Vancouver. Within 5-20 minutes, you can walk to the waterfront, shopping on Robson, Stanley Park, or to many wonderful restaurants. I would highly recommend the Shangri-La as the place to stay if you're in Vancouver. It is a bit pricey but well worth it to experience a hotel at its very best.

Reviews.Title: “quiet elegance!”
Reviews.Author: plumber83
Reviews.Content: We only stay in five star hotels and this was by far above and beyond the rest. Location is great! Staff are amazing, facilities are the best with all the most advanced and user friendly. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, Luxurious Guest Rooms”
Reviews.Author: corpevents
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel - entire staff from Sales & Conference Services to the Valet, were easy to work with, knowledgeable, polite, friendly, welcoming, etc.

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel excemplifies excellence!”
Reviews.Author: TeahL
Reviews.Content: From the service, to the perfect location in downtown Vancouver; to the staff that serves their guests we absolutely love staying here. We travel a great deal to Vancouver on business and the Shangri-La is unquestionably our number one choice. We have yet to check into a room that honestly didn't feel like we were the first guests to have occupied the room as the rooms are that immaculate. The staff is very friendly and welcoming from check-in, to the outstanding quality of service and food offered at the various restaurants...you won't be disappointed....l

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: tobanker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shangri-la hotel in Vancouver. My wife and are regular visitors to Bangkok and always stay at the Shangri-la so we are well aware that the quality and service levels are of the highest standards. The Vancouver hotel maintains those standards. One point to offer- there are no harbour views from the rooms as the top floor is the 15th and the hotel is surrounded by other buildings. That said, the rooms are beautifully designed and offer a great experience. I have attached photos.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: Traveler22304
Reviews.Content: A memorable hotel. Elegant rooms, excellent service, and superb food.

Reviews.Title: “lovely new hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BeijingAussieinchina
Reviews.Content: After much consideration and as a fan of shangri-la hotels I decided to stay here for 6 nights - breakfast and internet access included. The hotel is quite new and has a chi spa (not visited). The hotel is accessed via an underground driveway with lift access to the lobby and concierge and lifts to the rooms. The rooms are very well appointed including L'occitane toiletries, TV screen in the bathroom mirror, black out electronic blinds, and mood settings and dimmer switches on the lights, and an ipod docking station. The room also had a Nespresso coffee machine which was a great idea and very welcome!! The TV menu was very comprehensive and the screen was a large flat panel. The fitness centre is located adjacent to the spa and has a good range of Technogym cardio and weights machines and free weights, as well as a Technogym Kinesis station. While breakfast was included in the room rate I selected, I was unaware that it was not a buffet and only included food up to a set amount. However there are plenty of alternatives very close to the hotel including Urban Fare next door - a grocery/takeaway/eatin store, many Starbucks, and an IGA store a few blocks away. The concierge was very helpful and efficient, and assisted me with ideas for activities and changing and making bookings for tours etc. The location of the hotel is good although if you choose to take the skytrain to/from the airport, the closest stations require walking a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: BrightblueSunflower
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La Vancouver is a dream come true. Beautiful hotel, lovely athmosphere, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast, valet parking and concierge services - top class! Arriving to the hotel was pleasant enough, but entering the room took my breath away. Simply amazing. The best hotel ever. Without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “5-STAR SERVICE AT A 2-STAR PRICE”
Reviews.Author: bk994
