Reviews.Content: Can't beat the quality and service. Food is top-notch, although room service is significantly pricier than you'd expect for what you get, even for a five star hotel. However, that's a minor critique for an overall excellent experience. Staff was very friendly and attentive and hotel is right in the middle of downtown. Wouldn't recommend anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms wonderful staff great location excellent food”
Reviews.Author: Neal2277
Reviews.Content: My son was offered enrollment in UBC so we went up to Vancouver to visit the school. I was able to book a room at theShangri la and with prepayment got a rate of $206 per night with free wifi, free parking and $60 dollars credit per day for breakfast. All in all this made it an affordable stay in a city with many very expensive hotels--all of which charge for the extras. Don't forget that Vancouver taxes add almost another 18%. The hotel was top flight with great linens, fancy marble bathroom--the TV built into the bathroom mirror was a bit over the top, but neat--slippers robes and a safe that fits laptops. Called room service for a bucket of ice and I swear they appeared in less than five minutes. The staff was helpful, friendly and remembered my name. The decor and influance is asian--you will be handed your keys with both hands try to remember to accept them with two hands as well. Parking is underground and comes in from the rear of the hotel. Not a big deal although I've seen reviews that complained about it. It's the tallest building downtown and distinctive looking so it is easy to find when walking around or driving into the city. We were in the smallest of their rooms on the 15th floor and didn't have much of a view due to the other high rise buildings--the other side of the building offers balconies and larger rooms--if you want a view make sure you inquire or make a request. I would have killed for an upgrade! Try the bar menu for an evening snack good burgers--we were there for the Stanley Cup playoffs and it was an interesting, multicultural, handsome and classy/casual crowd--they were serving buttered popcorn which sinfully rich. Eggs Benedict were great at breakfast and they had some really outstanding breakfast sausages (read not Jimmy Dean). Summary, if traveling on the expense account don't think twice-- just book it! If you are on your own dime check out their deals on their website. It is expensive but then so are all of the other good hotels in Vancouver and the Shangri la really does stand out. I'll be going to Xian China later this year and am looking forward to trying out their property there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every respect”
Reviews.Author: anthony_bowman
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Its a very new Hotel, great service (as you come to expect from the Shangri-La group), lovely staff, nice rooms (massive digital LCD tv), food and facilities also great. Room rate (last minute booking) was very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKevin07
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we checked in for a recent 4 day stay we realised that the Shangri La was special. The lobby is discreet and elegant and the building is the newest high rise in town. The room was faultless and immaculate. The beds were very comfortable , huge Sony Bravia TV, espresso machine, great bath , premium shower products and very quick wifi. The staff were faultless and the lunch menu at the restaurant was remarkable value at $20 a person. Great location in the centre of Downtown within very easy walking distance to great restaurants and sights. I couldnt fault the hotel - except on recollection maybe the Flat Screen TV was a little large for the room !!!

Reviews.Title: “Discrete high-end hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: RockP
Reviews.Content: Just stayed an evening in a deluxe room - very large and well appointed - and beautiful bathroom. Was upgraded upon arrival based on Tablet Plus membership. Also had early check in and late check out. Much has been made of the underground reception/lobby for check-in/out. Definitely has advantages for those interested in privacy/discretion/quiet. I see it as a plus having experienced it firsthand, unless you like the hustle and bustle of many downtown hotels. But remember this is more of a boutique hotel - only 119 rooms - which caters to a more discerning traveler who isn't concerned with seeing and being seen. You don't have the general public in common areas, so hotel has a calmer aura about it. Great location - near excellent shopping and dining. Staff were friendly and proficient. Breakfast is expensive but ours was included as was valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo chic!”
Reviews.Author: Karen00000000000000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to a wedding downtown so we booked into the Shangri-la overnight. It was a fantastic experience from start to end. The rooms are perfectly appointed with tasteful furniture, art and textures. The ability to control all the lighting and draperies with the push of a button from the bed was decadent. The TV in the mirror made getting ready to go out a lot more fun. The bed was so soft! All the staff were professional and very helpful. A very worthwhile splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, but staff not up to par”
Reviews.Author: vancouverchu
Reviews.Content: Spring package is an unbeliveable value including valet parking and breakfast. Arrived to check in and the gal (new, limited training) was unable to locate my reservation. After 10 mins, she found it and proceed to go thru the details in a very slow manner, suggesting I join their Golden Circle program. Well, I was already a member, and needless to say, their reservation neglected this. Upon presenting my card, she attempted to find a room upgrade, but the manager on duty stepped in to speed up the process (line-up was growing). In a very unpleasant tone, he advise no other room was available. Breakfast also involved a long wait for a table, not that they were full, but under staffed. Modern facility, but service is far inferior to Shangri La hotels in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “We booked a get away package with...”
Reviews.Author: MrP9
Reviews.Content: We booked a get away package with breakfast and parking included. Staff were very helpful, very professional, and happy we were at their hotel. Yes, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite, but regardless, we were treated like 5 star guests in a 5 star hotel. Room...awesome...the famous mirror TV did not work (battery dead) and we were greeted with a welcome note and fruit thing for some doctor who obviously couldn't make it. Undeniably the best hotel stay of our lives... Breakfast was fabulous and location was perfect for exploring downtown. Price for what we got...excellent. Yes we checked in underground and did wait 10 minutes for checkout...line up...but the stay and experience will bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply serene.”
Reviews.Author: HelloCalgary
Reviews.Content: As I flew into Vancouver, all I had in hand was a map to find the Shangri-La Hotel. I was traveling on business and the reservation had been arranged for me. To be honest, I had never heard of the Shangri-La. Upon arrival I was immediately impressed with the genuine feeling of "Welcome" by all staff. Once inside the hotel there is a feeling of calmness that comes, almost instantly as the staff warmly greets you and offers their help. The room decor is classic, simple and warm. The almost "unseen" staff work very diligently to keep your room tidy and clean. The food served was always of the highest quality, fresh and pleasing. I highly recommend the Shangri-La Vancouver as it would be such an enjoyable experience not soon forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service, wonderful food and child friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Elreid02
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for several nights. The hotel was wonderful! The service was exemplary. The wait staff in the restaurant were very accommodating to my children's dietary needs and the food was excellent. I did visit the spa as well which was also a great experience. The hotel is close to the beautiful Stanley Park and shopping destinations are also very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic location, accomadating staff, very elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: shankar_wa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la for a night with our 10 month old son. The staff were accomdating in providing us with a microwave int he room and cleaning our the mini-bar so we could store his food in there, The room was very elegant and nice, the bathroom was great and the electirc mirror with the built-in TV was a nice novelty The 50inch TV in the room were actually a little too big for the room. The overall process of checkin was very efficient and it was nice to see the small touches they had in the room like the fruits and cookies in the room, the master switch to trun off the lights, the torch light in the night stand, charging station built into the desk and the ample number of open plugs. The amenties provided in the bath room were also were thoughtful - they had touthbrush, shaving razor, bath tub salts etc. The location was great and the breakfast at the MARKET was very good. Some of the things that i felt lacking were the confusing building access, the bathtub and toilet were a little dirty, the room service was slow and forgot to bring things when e requested them. Some of the staff were new to the hotel and the country itself and had a hard time communicating and understanding. The fitness room was very mediocore for this being a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Fantastic Service. A Step Above.”
Reviews.Author: PuffleNB
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Shangri-La Hotel. Having stayed at many fine hotels around the world this was a step above. We will definitely stay at the Shangri-La in Vancouver again and we will look for their other locations around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food and service in Marketplace restaurant”
Reviews.Author: lovethefood095
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at hotel but had a birthday dinner which was great! Staff was all very accommodating and food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service at an exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: mischa3000
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 guys on a bachelor party with a one night stopover in Vancouver; given the cultural Asian influence of the city we decided the Shangri La would be a fitting choice. Suffice to say it was a GREAT choice with plenty of praise to boot. Above all it was their level of service and attention to detail that has all of us speaking of that hotel to this day, we have all vowed to return with our significant others. The rooms are spacious, modern, and extremely comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is what all hotels should aspire to”
Reviews.Author: BuongustaioSempre
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels all over Asia and Europe, my wife and I have developed an appreciation for what a truly high quality hotel can offer. Although many describe themselves as 4 and 5 star, few ever achieve a level of quality that justifies those ratings. The Shangri La hotel in Vancouver, in our experience, well deserves the rating of 5 stars. The friendliness and professionalism of the staff is very impressive. The quality, cleanliness and comfort of the rooms were admirable, with the furnishings and style of décor being of the highest quality and also very soothing. Also, the Chinese breakfast we had in the restaurant was absolutely delicious and very well presented. Every encounter we had with the staff during our stay made us feel like a truly valued customer, even although we were there for just the one night on this occasion. One unique aspect of this hotel, that may surprise the first time visitor, is that the reception and concierge areas are quite small. Although this is unusual, the lasting impression is that this contributes to a feeling of warmth not found with hotels that have larger areas for these functions. This experience reminded us of staying at a 5 star hotel in Asia, which continent we have found has a much better appreciation of what constitutes a luxury hotel. Needless to say, this hotel will from now on be our first choice when staying in Vancouver, and our recommendation to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb. The rooms were roomy and beautiful. No expense has been spared. The washrooms were beautiful which includes a fairly large television in addition to excellent bath products. The service was excellent. I am accustomed to staying at high end hotels and this was my first exposure to the Shangri-La. It did not disappoint and actually exceeded my expectations. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous service and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ORJimmyT
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay at this fabulous hotel. Service, room and restaurant were first class. Everyone went out of their way to make my stay comfortable. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Opulent Perfection”
Reviews.Author: MightyHedgehog
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the valet entrance we knew we were in for a treat when we saw immaculately presented staff, stunning decor and even a beautiful chandelier, all in the underground car park! Our room was breathtaking and we had no end of fun finding out what all the different switches around the room would do! The bathroom was large and spotless with bespoke vanity units in dark wood and featured a large luxurious bath. A shower area and toilet area were both separated from the main part of the bathroom by etched glass doors; the TV hidden in the bathroom mirror was a great way to catch up with the morning news. A handwritten personal note from the manager was very welcoming. Our morning visit to the gym was wonderful: the up to date equipment was positioned to give us breath-taking views of the cityscape below. The outside pool and jacuzzi were very pleasant, even in the light November rain! Throughout our stay, the staff members were very attentive, very efficient and greeted us with politeness and warmth. The atmosphere was tranquil and restful at all times. The quality of finish through the entire hotel was world class and the building sits as a jewel in the Vancouver skyline. Our overall impression of our stay was that this is the ONLY place we want to stay when we're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCwinetraveller
Reviews.Content: No details left unturned, from Valet check-in to luxurious room. Bathroom was beautiful with features such as heated bathroom floor, inlaid TV in mirror, large tub and shower. Suite had everything imaginable, including shoe kit including polish and brushes. Push button drapes opened to view of the downtown city location. Full bar included any type of both non-alcoholic and alcoholic drink and BC wines. Expresso coffeemaker and kettle included for tea and coffee. Room had great light for reading and a large business desk with laptop plugins and adjustable lighting. Fresh fruit was left in room after turndown service. Would rank this among top hotels I have stayed in travels throughout North America.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: nwogaboy
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic,the furniture was very modern, bathroom and washing facilities were finished with white marble which was beautiful,and i loved the tele screen in the bathroom mirror.There are lots of electronic gismo's, like electric curtains, 42 inch flat screen T V, I pod dock etc. The central location of this hotel means its an ideal for a city break. A !

Reviews.Title: “Made our engagement weekend AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunsetmarina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend of four years proposed over the weekend at the hotel, and the staff were amazing! We were upgraded to a suite, given a bottle of champagne, and the manager wrote us congratulations cards. Their attention to detail is fantastic- ice brought to your room, beds turned down in the evening, shoe shining, complimentary water bottles, excellent bar area in the room, television in the bathroom, great soaps and toiletries... absolutely a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoaV
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and spacious. The restaurants is ok and the food pretty good. The spa at this hotel is simply amazing!!! You cannot stay at this hotel without trying theirs spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: uberator
Reviews.Content: From start to finish you are treated to the best service and top amenities in Vancouver. Valet is quick to great you by name and ensure your car cup holders are stocked with bottled water. Front desk guides you straight to your room for an in-room check-in. Room is finished with top of the line material, bed and linens. A great stay and worthy of the Shangri La Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Expert Service, Extraordinary Comfort, Delicious food and beveages!”
Reviews.Author: seattlen
Reviews.Content: Having had the distinct honor of being the first guest to check in to the Shangri-La Vancouver when it opened earlier this year, I have returned several times and have never been disappointed. I believe this is the gold standard for hotels in Vancouver for me, and I have stayed at most of the 4 stars at least once. I chose the Shangri-la as my new company hotel after some very disappointing stays at the Opus and the Fairmont. I have no regrets. I use the Shangri-la for business and leisure travel alike. A couple girlfriend getaways, entertaining family when they stayed in town at the same time I did, and to host clients when I needed a great meal and an elegant atmosphere to entertain in. All expectations exceeded, every time! Beginning with the speedy and very personal check-in service by one of their staff, butler style, you can quickly sort out your paperwork in the room and then commence to enjoying the amenities that the hotel lays before you: a welcome basket with fresh fruit and some wine and chocolate (part of the Golden Circle Amenities Program) a truly gigantic bathtub, a Magic Mirror TV (as my husband refers to them) in the large bathroom, exceptional toiletries, all the nice extra touches like toothbrush, razor and shaving cream, nail file, laundry powder, sea salts for your bath... all organized for your use. A large shower and a private toilet make this one of the nicest hotel bathrooms I have seen in a long time. Move to the bedroom and the well sized rooms have one-touch window coverings and lights all manged through a panel next to the bed. The sheets are perfectly soft and luxurious, and the bed is extraordinarily comfortable. I have been known to be a few minutes late for an event while I reluctantly ended a nap to go get ready. The gentle glow of the clock that lights up when touched is just another example of the un-intrusive comfort the rooms presents. Turn down service is always discreetly finished and ready for my restful night by the time I return from dinner or a cocktail. If I am using a meeting space, like the private screening room that can be rented for my company events, I am always pleased that the service extends to their banquet and catering staff. Lovely rooms. I would LOVE to attend a wedding here. It would be truly elegant! The Nespresso machine that I cant live without at home is also happily part of the rooms features, and I usually fix myself a quick shot of Cafe Roma while I get my luggage put away. My only wish here is that cold cream would be ready in the room for me. I usually stop by the Market next to the hotel to grab a small carton for my stay. Connectivity for your laptop is a snap, and everything you may need is a phone call away, and the staff always answers your call as if you were the most important guest in the hotel and your needs are met quickly and efficiently. When, and if, you leave the room, stop by the grand lobby lounge for a delicious "Pacific Rim" beverage prepared by Nadia or Shane, who will make your time there enjoyable and delicious. Stay and listen to the wonderful piano player in the lobby lounge transport you back in time to the swanky days of elegant entertaining. Work out in the private yoga room, the large and well appointed fitness room, or enjoy the locker rooms steam room to unwind solo. Lounge by the pool and enjoy the sun if there is any, or wander down to Jean Georges and enjoy the sexy vibe, for business or to unwind with your friends. Its a respectable mix between sleek and unpretentious. But more importantly the food is succulent and satisfying and treated with great care. Room service was always prompt and perfectly prepared. Any minor issue is fixed immediately, no questions asked. More cream? No problem, there in three minutes. I have had the formal tea in the afternoons as well, and it was a charming and unique way to entertain a client, she and I both had a wonderful time with it. I have spent a couple afternoons at the spa, Chi, and truly enjoyed the service and the fact that I actually felt relaxed when I left and went directly to my amazing room where I napped sufficiently until it was time to take the prompt car service to my next event. Join the Golden Circle club and enjoy extra ammenities and rapid check out. Or, as Shangri-La Vancouver inspired me to do, travel to one of their other hotels in Asia and you will find that the service extends across the oceans for a reason. This hotel group has truly defined their service standard and as a business or personal travel stay, they have made each one special and memorable. If you were to be visiting Vancouver for the upcoming Olympics, for an important business meeting, or as a special getaway, Shangri-La would be the best location for your stay. Enjoy it, for even 24 hours here can feel like a wonderful vacation. Thank you to the staff of this exemplary hotel! Go, stay, relax, luxuriate, enjoy... and return again and again! Hint: Ask for the "Experience Shangri-La Package" when you book your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel experience in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: silvertreenorth
Reviews.Content: I spend a great deal of time travelling for business and staying in some pretty gorgeous hotels in North America . I must say that the new Shangri La hotel in Vancouver is all you could desire in a hotel - The room was exquisitely appointed, the bed and sheets glorious, the bathroom and fixtures perfect, the room products all good quality, and all the tiny touches like the button that closes the drapes, the dimmers for all the lighting -lovely ! the best part of the hotel is the staff they are really polite helpful and accommodating. all of it done in a simple and elegant way - Plus room service was fast and efficient with great food as well . I would highly recommend this hotel to any traveller that wants the best of hotel living !

Reviews.Title: “Finally, Vancouver is catching up to the world”
Reviews.Author: DA00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vancouver for a "mini-moon" after our wedding. The location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing. The porters were excellent, reception immediately realised we were recently married and referred to me as "Mrs" which was a smooth touch. The hotel provided complimentary honeymoon goodies which were decadent The room was excellent in quality and the amenities first class. There was an I-Pod docking station, tv, DVD etc. The bathroom was large, unusual for vancouver, with a large bath, walk-in shower We enjoyed our daily breakfast in the room, some very polite people who answered the phones and the ones who delivered our food. The swimming pool was shallow, however, served its purpose if, as I, you wanted to swim lengths. The fitness room was excellent and the machinery was all up-to-date. We found the changing rooms and spa equally excellent. We enjoyed afternoon tea and a few drinks before dinner. Their restaurant Market by Jean Georges is certainly the talk of the town, a lot of popular faces. The concierge was exceptional and very professional in their work. I cannot fault a thing at this prestigious hotel. Will definitely be visiting again!!

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful Shangri La Hotel, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: GreatNeckGreatNeck
Reviews.Content: Dear Eleanor and Andrew, Thank you for a wonderful informative few days. I decided that I am a Shangri La "groupie." The central location of the hotel makes it easy to visit most of the sites of Vancouver. From the moment one enters the Shangri La Hotel, the atmosphere is one of serenity, incorporating a relaxing ambiance due in no small part to the scent throughout. I found the underlining feeling of the hotel to be contemporary and comfortable while not being overly trendy. The lobby is welcoming and the separation of the lower lobby from the upper lobby turned a potential problem into an asset, separating vehicular traffic from pedestrian traffic. The rooms are not identical in shape which is a plus. Every client has different requirements.Some like spacious rooms while others prefer large bathrooms and closets. Thus, a room can be assigned accordingly. The lighting in the bedroom was tactfully done and the bathroom lighting was bright enough so one can see. The bathtub has a back support and the additional amenities, (bath salts and lufa, special beds and bedding, pillow menu, the clock that lights up when touched and does not glare at you in the dark) make one realize that a lot of thought went into making the rooms extremely efficient, as well as comfortable . The wonderful balconies afford a spectacular view of the city. CHI is the ideal place to relax and unwind after a busy day, with different treatments to fit varied needs and time constraints of hotel guests. John George restaurant serves exceptional meals from breakfast to a wonderful dinner. The French toast offered on the breakfast menu is exceptionally good, as was everything we sampled for dinner. The formal tea was also an experience, with sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and sweets, not to mention the beautiful china on which it is served. Your entire staff was polite, attentive and helpful. Evy Edelman

Reviews.Title: “I found my Shangri-La and didn't have to go to Asia...”
Reviews.Author: andrewrnyc
Reviews.Content: They did it. Smaller scale, but they achieved that five star Asian style of luxury. The settin is elegant and modern, not trendy. The arrival experience is very surprising. Being driven to the hotel down a ramp to the lower lobby, I was greeted by three people: one to get my luggage, one to direct the driver where to exit and the other to escort me to my guest room for check in. Total privacy. How nice... The bellman arrived during the short check in and explained everthing that my room conceiled. There is an amasing sound system under the TV. ipod station next to the bed. Control panel next to the bed to adjust everything in the room to set my mood for anything. It's like a showroom. Italian hand crafted furniture to envoke the feel of Vancouver, technology that offers everything (biggest TV in the city), and my favorite are the drape controls. Oh, I didn't mention the floor to ceiling marble bathrooms with TV hidden in the mirror. Not to mention the large glass shower with ajoining seperate tub. Did I mention floor to ceiling windows with shade controls. Amenities: L'Occitane, even bath salts. Entertaining: Market, by Jean Georges. Four areas to relax, impress or pick up. The lounge is sexy and not pretentious. The cafe, casual and affordable with a fire place. The terrace offers out door sexy mingling. The dining room bellows with banquettes and two private dining rooms. I need to figure my next event to host there overlooking Vancouver streets. Fitness facilities had to be over 5,000 feet. This is serious. Windows and new equiptment. Trainers on request that also offer access to another high energy facitilty accross the street. How about the outdoor pool and hot tub? They top it all off with a juice bar with a European goddess that knows what each fruit can offer to replenish your body. The lobby, sexy and tailored with some shimmer. Anyone arriving into the Shangri-La knows this is a committed luxe hotel that does it in subtle ways. No attitude. Just warm freindly styles. They have the magic of figuring out each guest to see what will make me feel comfortable and welcome, like they were expecting me. It may also be my fantastic travel agent. So for a Shang, this one is the sweet little stylish sister that moved to Vancouver. She is figuring out her space and emitting her flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikkiS7
Reviews.Content: There is only one complaint that I have, and it's petty I admit. The car entrance is underground; we circled probably 2-3x trying to find the entrance, but once we stepped foot into the hotel that made up for it. Very professional the way we were escorted to our room with guided tour. Explanation of what we ordered and preliminary charges. My boyfriend's computer was not picking up the free WiFi signal. They immediately sent up their IT guys to work on it...even though we never got connected they worked very diligently. Location is perfect. Right next to Robson Street. Breakfast, great. Professional and patient concierge. LOVED the bathroom. The suite we were in was impressive. Staff were exemplary. No complaints at all. They made sure we were comfortable during every second of our stay. Not to the point of nagging though. All in all, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best from the rest”
Reviews.Author: anderson25
Reviews.Content: After reading many mixed hotel reviews and upcoming weather reports for the region and I was frustrated. Then I remembered my stay at Shangri-la Hong Kong—where the accommodations, service and general atmosphere made the hectic center of hongkong City feel like a leisurely escape. I had been to their properties in Cairns, andBeijing as well. There is a consistent feeling when you enter a Shangri-La—it is calming, sophisticated and luxurious—what I wanted in a business environment or romantic/leisure getaway this brand has it. The hotel staff were excellent throughout our stay and I'd like to take this opportunity of thanking them for a truly wonderful service. First class hotel and fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the full Shangri-La experience”
Reviews.Author: kenmaestro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in April 2009 so it had only just opened. The underground arrival is slightly weird but very efficient and I was escorted up to my 'upgraded' suite. I had book a deluxe corner king with balcony and was given a suite that, whilst beautifully appointed, had the most odd proportions and NO balcony. Many of the things one comes to expect from Shangri-La in Asia were in place - I took breakfast in my room each morning and it was beautifully presented and perfectly prepared, the bathroom was almost as big as the sitting room and was wonderfully appointed. The bedroom had a huge (50"?) wall TV. It was so huge that the only place from where you could properly view it was in bed! When you take the elevator to the lobby you find yourself in a rather strange granite sided 'void' or that's at least how it feels. I took lunch one day at Market and it certainly lived up to Jean-George's East Coast reputation. In summary, certainly worth the special deal that I booked but will find it difficult to justify the racj rate of anything close. It's a very good addition to the Vancouver scene and may help bring the standard of other 'wannabe' properties (q.v. the Grande Residences at Sutton Place) up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Unsophisticated Staff- consierge”
Reviews.Author: roxygirlVancouver
Reviews.Content: My spouse & I booked a weekend stay at the Shagri-la in Vancouver for our anniversary, and we were sadly disappointed regarding the level of service we received for what we paid. The amount of money we paid, should have reflect ed world class service and the Shangri -la & all of its unsophisticated phony staff, (especially the consierge who looked like he didn't want to be there) failed to deliver. I bet that when he goes somewhere, he expects to be treated like a King by everyone, but my wife & I were treated like we were staying at the Best Western. This hotel is overrated and failed to deliver. We will not recommend this hotel to anyone. What a joke.
